Kelly, then head of the United States Southern Command, delivered a dire warning to Congress: The nation was not focusing on the security threat presented by the financial and operational relationship between terrorist networks and drug smuggling organizations.

title: The Fading Art Deco Dreams of Brazils Heartland
description: GOINIA, Brazil  On a recent visit to Goinia, a bustling city noted for its sway in Brazils farm belt, I didnt expect to stumble across Art Deco gems. But there they were, amid spacious parks, plazas and tree-lined avenues: a train station, a theater, a palace, some government buildings.

title: The Best and Worst of the Golden Globes
description: Heres a look at the most memorable moments from the 2017 Golden Globes, including Meryl Streeps acceptance speech, Jimmy Fallons lackluster hosting, funny presenters and awkward flubs.

title: Daily Report: Virtual Reality Has Not Quite Arrived
description: Technology products often go through a hype cycle: It starts with excessive enthusiasm (the hype), then it moves into a period of disillusionment (the anger). And, finally, reality.

title: Bitter Fate of Coffee Beans
description: Q. What chemical changes occur with dark-roasting coffee beans? Are they what make coffee bitter?

title: Lightning, Weathers Byproduct, May Become One of Its Predictors
description: Lightnings intricate, darting dance across the sky can be mesmerizing or terrifying, elegant or explosive, divine or destructive, depending on how close it is.

title: Add a Rainbow of Color to Your Baking Sheet
description: Since introducing the Mason jar cocktail shaker nearly three years ago, Eric Prum and Josh Williams at W&P Design have come up with other clever items for eating and drinking from their headquarters in Greenpoint, Brooklyn. The companys new baking blankets, nonstick silicone and fiberglass sheets for lining baking pans, come in vibrant patterns inspired by Mexican textiles. Use them as place mats or underpinnings for trays, or for turning an ordinary cutting board into a bright serving piece. These microwave- and dishwasher-safe mats come in red, pink and blue and measure 11 by 16 inches: Baking Blankets, $20, wandpdesign.com.

title: Tomatillo Fossils, 52 Million Years Old, Are Discovered in Patagonia
description: The nightshades have an ominous reputation, but this large plant family is more than just its most poisonous members, like belladonna. It contains more than 2,400 different species, including some of the most widely consumed fruits and vegetables in the world, such as potatoes, tomatoes and peppers.

title: For Troubled Student, a Change of School and Direction
description: For Najairee Davis, high school was synonymous with bouts of anger and frustration. She had the hallway fights, suspensions and detention to prove it.

title: Looking at Your Home Planet from Mars
description: Greetings Earthlings! This is your planet and its moon as seen from Mars, some 127 million miles away.

title: For the Mustard Lover Who Has Everything
description: Umami in a jar is an apt description for this limited-edition mustard from Maille. Available through the end of the month, the mustard, seasoned with earthy black truffles and the essence of cep, or porcini, mushrooms, comes in a ceramic crock made in France. A black truffle and Chablis winter mustard is available through March 31: Black truffle and cep mustard and black truffle and Chablis mustard, $43 for 4.4 ounces, $68 for 8.8 ounces and $118 for 17.6 ounces (Chablis version only); Maille boutiques and maille.com.

title: Roll Tide (Hold That Tiger)
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: A New Sandwich Shop for Union Square
description: A tempting lineup of sandwiches awaits at the compact new Make Sandwich shop from Spencer Rubin, who owns the Melt Shop chain. He hired Josh Sharkey, the founder of Bark Hot Dogs, as culinary director. The nine preset sandwich combinations, like tri-tip steak with salsa verde, range in price from $7.95 to $11.95. All sandwiches are made to order in five to seven minutes with ingredients like Parmigiano-Reggiano, organic eggs and Pain dAvignon bread. You can devise your own from a long list of choices for $10.95, with extra charges for some toppings: Make Sandwich, 135 Fourth Avenue (at 14th Street), 212-398-2602, makesandwich.com.

title: Wine and Spirits on the Way to the Train
description: Look to the right as you enter Central Cellars, the new wine and spirits shop in Grand Central Terminal, and you will see a small display of limited-edition, high-end bourbons: rare bottles of Pappy Van Winkles, at $3,500, and such. Lee Tachman, the owner, has a clientele that appreciates such whiskeys. They buy them to open, not just to collect, he said. He has also taken a clever approach with his wines. Most of the bottles at eye level on the shelves range from $20 to $35. Thats the sweet spot, Mr. Tachman said. They have six minutes to their trains, and they can grab one of these. Several sommeliers, some certified by the Wine & Spirit Education Trust, work in the store: Central Cellars, across from Track 17, Grand Central Terminal, 89 East 42nd Street, 212-687-1300, centralcellars.com.

title: Stop and Acknowledge How Much Luck Has to Do With Your Success
description: I have a lucky friend. Chances are you know him. He has written several New York Times best sellers. By any outward appearance, he has officially made it.

title: Maple Syrups Taken to the Edge
description: Runamok Maple taps 81,000 trees in northern Vermont for its syrups. The Sugarmakers Cut is the classic, but the line of infused and smoked syrups is where things get interesting. There is an alluring blend, aged in rye whiskey barrels; a haunting one smoked with pecan wood; and a pungent, cardamom-infused variety: $16.95 to $19.95 for an 8.45-ounce bottle (the Sugarmakers Cut is $16.96 for 12.7 ounces or $27.95 for 25.4 ounces),  boxed assortments are $29.95 to $74.95, runamokmaple.com.

title: U2 Will Revisit The Joshua Tree on 30th Anniversary Stadium Tour
description: U2 will spend the summer of 2017 reimagining 1987.

title: A Strike Empties Londons Underground. Aboveground Is a Different Story.
description: LONDON  Londoners struggled to maintain their poise on Monday after a 24-hour strike on the Underground forced the evacuations of subway stations, left buses dangerously crammed and made thousands of commuters walk for hours to get to and from work.

title: No Chianti, but Plenty to Chew On
description: Cannibalism exists among polar bears, spiders, tadpoles, chimpanzees, sharks and humans. Bill Schutt, a professor of biology at Long Island University and a researcher at the American Museum of Natural History, will discuss it at the museum, along with his new book, Cannibalism: A Perfectly Natural History, which will be published next month: Cannibalism lecture, Feb. 16 at 6:30 p.m., $15, $13.50 for those 65 and older and students, members free; Kaufman/Linder Theater, American Museum of Natural History, 77th Street between Central Park West and Columbus Avenue, amnh.org.

title: Criminal Complaint Against VWs Compliance Manager
description: Oliver Schmidt, a German who is the former top emissions compliance manager for Volkswagen in the United States, was arrested by investigators in Florida on a charge of conspiracy to defraud the United States.

title: Vivienne Westwood: Mens Collection
description: Ms. Westwood shows her fall 2017 mens designs.

title: Saudi Women Cause Stir in Music Video
description: A bright and upbeat music video of Saudi women has rapidly spread across social media, viewed more than three million times since it was uploaded to YouTube two weeks ago. The video, which challenges the country's patriarchal culture, has prompted debate over the role of women in Saudi society.

title: Golden Globes Broadcast Shows Slight Uptick in Ratings
description: LOS ANGELES  By the only measure that truly matters, the Nielsen ratings, Jimmy Fallons turn as the Golden Globes host on Sunday night appears to have been a modest success.

title: How to Navigate New Airline Carry-On Rules
description: Its the first year that United Airlines will be offering basic economy fares  the lowest prices on a particular flight, but with notable restrictions such as: You dont receive a seat assignment until check-in (and sitting next to your traveling companions is not guaranteed); youre the last to board; and youre not allowed to bring on a full-size carry-on bag (which means no use of the overhead bins).

title: Turkeys Parliament Starts Debate on Expansion of Presidents Powers
description: The Turkish Parliament began debating legislation on Monday that would effectively rewrite the Constitution, vastly expanding the powers of Turkeys president, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, and possibly allowing him to remain in power until 2029.

title: Review: The Adventures of Candide, and of City Opera
description: Since New York City Opera emerged from bankruptcy a year ago, its been hard to know what to make of it. Is this venture truly a renaissance of the venerable company that went out of business in 2013 after 70 adventurous years? Or should the quite variable productions that have been offered over the past year be seen as the first steps of a completely reconceived City Opera?

title: Smaller Airports Get the Attention of International Carriers
description: WINDSOR LOCKS, Conn.  For as long as airlines have been crossing the oceans, airline passengers have had to go to big city airports to catch their overseas flights.

title: One Phone, Many Instagram Accounts
description: Q. I have two different Instagram accounts. Is there a way to use both on my phone at the same time without constantly entering the name and password?

title: After Playoff Loss, the Giants Hope Theyre Only Young Once
description: The Giants this season were a young team that overachieved, a squad that quickly transformed a franchise stumbling and bewildered after three consecutive losing seasons into a surprising playoff contender. And when hope was restored with a postseason berth, it re-energized a flagging fan base.

title: Casey Affleck: Thanks for Dressing Up
description: To be fair to Casey Affleck, he is not the biggest schlump in show business. Adam Sandler takes that prize. And lets state upfront that we are talking here strictly in sartorial terms. There is plenty to be said about the more serious of Mr. Afflecks shortcomings, the ones that have led him to settle two sexual harassment cases out of court and that some say may cost him the Oscar.

title: For Train Kids, the Second Avenue Subway Is a Dream Come True
description: I had never asked my six-year-old son about his dreams before, and he had never brought it up. But last Monday, his book of choice at bedtime, Steam Train, Dream Train, gave me an opening.

title: Giant Sequoia Tunnel Tree in California Is Toppled by Storm
description: A giant ancient sequoia with a hollowed-out tunnel that drew thousands of visitors each year in California toppled over on Sunday during heavy rains, according to a nonprofit group.

title: 2016 Was Second-Warmest Year on Record in U.S.
description: The average temperature of the lower 48 states reached the second-highest level in the historical record in 2016, the government said on Monday. The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration reported that only 2012 had been warmer in archives stretching to 1895.

title: A Slower Pace for TVs Galloping Gourmet
description: MOUNT VERNON, Wash.  He injected extra fat into already well-marbled roasts, with a grin and an ever-present glass of wine. He laughed uproariously at his own jokes, and told Americans that cooking at home did not have to be particularly sophisticated or difficult (Julia Child, the only other major TV chef of his era, had pretty much staked out that turf anyway) to be wild, and wildly fun.

title: What Happened Within This Players Skull
description: New research is shedding light on just what happens inside the brain during blows to the head.

title: The Most Interesting, Unexpected Looks at the 2017 Golden Globes
description: From Isabelle Hupperts diamond ear cuff to Sienna Millers ponytail and pearls, Sundays awards show delivered a unique sense of cool.

title: Soundtracks Dominate the Top 10 and the Weeknd Returns to No. 1
description: The Weeknds album Starboy (XO/Republic) returns to Billboards No. 1 spot after five weeks, with 18,000 sales and 59 million streams, according to Nielsen. But some of the most interesting developments in music sales are not in what made it to No. 1.

title: A New Three-Piece Beauty Line for Sensitive Types
description: If you look at my LinkedIn profile, it might seem surprising that I started a beauty brand, admits Johanna Peet, the founder and C.E.O. of the new skin-care range Peet Rivko. To date, the 32-year-olds rsum includes working as a staff assistant to the head of the counterterrorism bureau for the U.S. Department of State and studying human rights and social entrepreneurship at New York University, where she earned her J.D. and M.B.A. But the idea for a beauty company was always in the back of my mind, says Peet, who has been mixing up gentle, plant-based remedies for the last 10 years, as an alternative to the harsh and synthetic ingredients found in many mainstream lotions and oils that irritated her sensitive complexion. In her final year at N.Y.U. in 2015, Peet dreamed up Peet Rivko, a pared-back, unisex collection of daily essentials that launches today with a calming cleanser, moisturizer and face oil.

title: To Improve Your Sense of Direction, Lose the Technology
description: Are you one of those people who get lost in walk-in closets? Do you build in extra travel time to account for getting lost? Is your sense of direction like a weather vane spinning in strong winds?

title: Seeing the Upside as FIFA Votes on Expanding the World Cup
description: FIFA has been here before. Accused of trying to fix something that is not broken, criticized for abandoning the tried and tested for the unwieldy and unwanted, told it is sacrificing quality for quantity, warned that it is greed that tends to kill off the goose that lays the golden eggs.

title: Suspect in Fort Lauderdale Airport Shooting Is Assigned a Lawyer
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla.  Looking frail and meek, Esteban Santiago, the man accused of fatally shooting five people and wounding six others at the airport in this South Florida city three days ago, made a brief appearance on Monday in a federal courtroom here and was assigned a public defender because he cannot afford a lawyer.

title: Trumps Industry Criticisms Shift Detroit Auto Shows Focus
description: DETROIT  President-elect Donald J. Trump is not attending the countrys premier auto show here. But his vow to impose tariffs on imports from Mexico has changed the focus of the show from what new vehicles are on display to where they are made.

title: U.S. Blacklists 5 Russians, a Close Putin Aide Among Them
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration has blacklisted five Russians, including the governments chief public investigator, who is a close aide to President Vladimir V. Putin, for human rights abuses, laying down a marker for President-elect Donald J. Trump less than two weeks before he takes office with a vow to thaw relations with Russia.

title: Orlando Police Officer Shot and Killed; Manhunt Underway for Suspect
description: A police officer in Orlando, Fla., was shot and killed on Monday morning by a man wanted in the death of his pregnant former girlfriend, the authorities said. A manhunt was underway for the suspect.

title: The Senate Mustnt Rush on Donald Trumps Nominees
description: To the Editor:

title: Goldman Sachs Names Elisha Wiesel Chief Information Officer
description: The son of the Holocaust survivor and activist Elie Wiesel, Elisha Wiesel, is taking over the top technology job at Goldman Sachs.

title: Donald Trump, Taiwan, Meryl Streep: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Meryl Streeps Political Statement at the Golden Globes
description: To the Editor:

title: Tapas Bars Added at 2 Manhattan Restaurants
description: This might be a case of great minds  or chefs and restaurateurs  thinking alike. Both La Sirena in Chelsea and Il Buco Alimentari e Vineria in NoHo have added tapas bars.

title: Martin McGuinness, Sinn Fein Official, Quits Northern Ireland Government, Setting Off Shake-Up
description: DUBLIN  The top Catholic official in Northern Irelands power-sharing government abruptly resigned on Monday, plunging the territory into political uncertainty and adding to Britains complications as it plans to leave the European Union.

title: Bonnie Wong, Gary Van Vliet
description: Bonnie Michelle-Jo Wong and Gary Lucas Van Vliet were married Jan. 7 at Grand Central Terminal in Manhattan. Wesley Wong, the brother of the bride, who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Supreme Court Seems Wary of Hurdles for Refunds of Fines After Exonerations
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday seemed deeply skeptical of a Colorado law that makes it hard for criminal defendants whose convictions are overturned to get refunds of the fines and restitution they had been ordered to pay.

title: Drivers License Suspensions
description: To the Editor:

title: Trump Reacts to Russian Hacking; His Voters Shrug It Off
description: To the Editor:

title: Deadly Checkpoint Attack in Egypt's Sinai
description: An attack by militants on an Egyptian police checkpoint in the northern Sinai Peninsula left at least nine people dead on Monday. The group rammed a stolen garbage truck packed with explosives into the checkpoint, setting off clashes with security forces, officials said.

title: Pope Francis Reiterates Support for Breast-Feeding in Public
description: Pope Francis encouraged women attending Mass at the Sistine Chapel on Sunday to breast-feed in public, telling them they could calm their crying babies by nursing them just as the Virgin Mary nursed the baby Jesus.

title: Jared Kushner Named Senior White House Adviser to Donald Trump
description: WASHINGTON  Jared Kushner will become a senior White House adviser to his father-in-law, Donald J. Trump, cementing the New York real estate executives role as a powerful and at times decisive influence on the president-elect.

title: A Permanent Plinth for New Art Coming to the High Line
description: London has its Fourth Plinth, where contemporary artists have graced  and sometimes goaded  viewers in Trafalgar Square with sculptural work on a bare pedestal originally intended for an equestrian statue of William IV.

title: From Rome, a Homey Mens Shop in Manhattan
description: Ninety years ago, in Rome, Davide Cencis grandfather opened a shop that specialized in mens shirts and pajamas. Its customers included members of the Italian Parliament, who worked next door. Today there are four Davide Cenci shops  two in Rome (one for childrens clothing), one in Milan and one in New York. Mr. Cenci took a few moments away from the racks at his homey Madison Avenue location, which has an emphasis on mens wear, to discuss the family business.

title: Study Finds Lower, but Still High, Rate of C-Sections in China
description: China, which has long been criticized for soaring C-section rates, actually has rates lower than previously reported, although they are still quite high, according to a large new study done jointly by Chinese and American scientists.

title: Militants Attack Police Checkpoint in Sinai, and ISIS Is Suspected
description: CAIRO  Gunmen assaulted a police checkpoint in the Sinai Peninsula of Egypt on Monday, killing at least nine people and wounding 12, an Egyptian police spokesman said, and Islamic State militants were suspected to be behind it.

title: Dancers Strip to Essentials in Basketball and TranSenses
description: While snow fell outside this weekend, dancers indoors were performing naked, on both the East and West Sides of Midtown Manhattan. In the premiere of Basketball, performed and choreographed by Molly Lieber and Eleanor Smith at the Howard Gilman Performance Space at the Baryshnikov Arts Center, nakedness was integral to a wholly serious, original, absorbing and peculiar production. It also occurred in more than one of the five pieces shown at Japan Society in the 17th Contemporary Dance Showcase: Japan + East Asia; there, however, it remained among several coy effects.

title: With Competition Fierce, Even Elite Law Firms Resort to the Unusual
description: Americas law firms, even the most prominent, are mired in an era of noticeably modest growth and volatility in the industry, and 2017 promises to be no better.

title: The Hunger Strike, the Protest Tactic of Gandhi, is Vexing Irans Penal Overseers
description: TEHRAN  The hunger strike, a pressure tactic of self-starvation used by political protesters around the world, is forcing Irans powerful judiciary to reconsider the conditions of at least one of its inmates after several started fasts that are leading to widespread support on social media.

title: Review: FXs Taboo, a British Costume Drama With Doom and Gloom
description: It doesnt take long to realize that Taboo, the heavy-breathing new FX series set in Regency England, is going to be very ripe viewing. Rain on the moors, tubs of offal, bodies with coppers on the eyes, grave robbers, a funeral procession led by a dwarf  were talking the whole dark-gothic playbook. And thats before we get to the half-sibling incest and the slave ship flashbacks and the Native American incantations.

title: At Golden Globes Afterparties, Stars Applaud Meryl Streep
description: At the Golden Globes afterparties, hoi polloi who arent invited to the ceremony descend by the thousands on the Beverly Hilton to whoop it up and stalk celebrities.

title: Intimate Vintage Photos of Hollywood (and New York) Royalty
description: The filmmaker Mark Romanek, best known for his three-decade career as a music video and film director, has spent years taking photos of his clients and friends.

title: Candid, Never-Before-Seen Photos of Robin Williams, Leonard Cohen, Jay Z and More
description: The last three decades of MTV might have looked very different without the influence of the filmmaker Mark Romanek. Since the beginning of his career in 1986, the director has made, along with three feature films, music videos for everyone from Michael and Janet Jackson (Scream) to Fiona Apple (Criminal) to Jay Z (99 Problems, Picasso Baby) and Taylor Swift (Shake It Off). Throughout all this, Romanek has taken pictures, too; and starting today, hell show around 30 of those black-and-white photos for the first time ever at Colette in Paris.

title: Wi-Fi and Cellphone Service at New York Subway Stations: Share Your Experience.
description: Wi-Fi and cellphone service are officially part of our underground commute. As of Monday, all New York City subway stations had cellphone service and free Wi-Fi connectivity. The project is part of a push by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo to connect the millions of on-the-go New Yorkers, commuters and tourists who rely on the subways every day.

title: Viola Davis, Ryan Reynolds and Tracee Ellis Ross Celebrate After the Golden Globe Awards
description: InStyle and Warner Bros. host a splashy party following the ceremony.

title: Womens March on Washington Opens Contentious Dialogues About Race
description: Many thousands of women are expected to converge on the nations capital for the Womens March on Washington the day after Donald J. Trumps inauguration. Jennifer Willis no longer plans to be one of them.

title: Viola Davis, Ryan Reynolds and Tracee Ellis Ross Celebrate After the Golden Globe Awards
description: Are stars really just like us?

title: Under New Chairman, S.E.C. Enforcer Role Might Shrink
description: The announcement by President-elect Donald J. Trump that he will nominate Walter J. Clayton, a quintessential Wall Street deal lawyer, as chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission raises questions about how securities laws will be enforced during the new administration.

title: What Rafsanjani's Death Means for Iran
description: Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani, the former president of Iran, died at 82 on Sunday. He was a president that favored closer ties with the West. Our Tehran bureau chief explains what Rafsanjani meant for Iran.

title: Smithsonian Hears Call for Womens Museum
description: Leading women from politics, the arts and other fields urged President-elect Donald Trump on Monday to support a new national womens museum in Washington that would be affiliated with the Smithsonian Institution.

title: For Vivienne Westwood, an Unsentimental Return to London
description: LONDON  After having shown her clothes on the runways of Milan and Paris since 1982, Dame Vivienne Westwood made a dramatic return to the city that made her a fashion star for London Fashion Week Mens.

title: Anthony Bennett, Cut by Nets, Stands Out Among N.B.A. Busts
description: In the final N.B.A. draft he presided over, in 2013, David Stern, then the leagues commissioner, shocked the crowd at Barclays Center when he announced that the Cleveland Cavaliers had taken Anthony Bennett with the No. 1 overall pick. A 6-foot-8 power forward who had played one year at Nevada-Las Vegas, Bennett was a surprise selection over Nerlens Noel and other top prospects.

title: These Foods Arent Genetically Modified but They Are Edited
description: In a few years, you could be eating the next generation of genetically altered foods  potatoes that do not turn brown or soybeans with a healthier mix of fatty acids.

title: Times Promotes David McCraw to Deputy General Counsel
description: David McCraw, the primary litigator for The New York Times, whose letter rebutting demands from Donald J. Trumps lawyer went viral last year, was promoted on Monday.

title: Mens Fashion Shows: J.W. Anderson, Wales Bonner, Craig Green and More
description: A photo diary of the fall/winter 2017 collections that were presented in London this weekend.

title: A Plea for Fifth Avenue
description: Presidential elections have consequences, and this one will affect New York City more than any in recent memory. This isnt a comment on the candidates or the nationwide political tone, but on the simple fact that the winner of this election, Donald J. Trump, lives in New York City. And not just in New York City, but on Fifth Avenue in Midtown Manhattan, home to one of the worlds densest concentrations of humanity and traffic bedlam.

title: The Dry, a Page-Turner of a Mystery Set in a Parched Australia
description: Jane Harpers The Dry is set in a parched Australian farming community within a days drive of Melbourne. Its a region that hasnt seen rain in two years, and the novels main character, Aaron Falk, is jolted to see that a rushing river he remembers from his youth has all but disappeared. Ms. Harper is not one to drop a fact like that without using it later. She has jampacked her swift debut thriller with sneaky moves that the reader has to track with care.

title: Specialty Pharmacies Say Benefit Managers Are Squeezing Them Out
description: From its storefront in Union City, N.J., Prime Aid Pharmacy caters to patients with a wide range of ailments, from rheumatoid arthritis to hepatitis C. The business prides itself on getting patients their necessary drugs, employs a staff that speaks 10 languages and delivers medications by car in New York and New Jersey.

title: Takedas Bid for Cancer Drug Maker Looks Expensive
description: Japanese companies overseas shopping sprees tend to be overpriced. Takeda Pharmaceutical is the latest acquirer to pay over the odds. Takeda, a $34 billion drug maker, is spending $5.2 billion, a 75 percent premium, for Ariad Pharmaceuticals, a biotechnology company with a middling cancer drug.

title: At the Golden Globes, a New Culture War Erupts Onstage
description: LOS ANGELES  It surprised no one that Hollywood used the Golden Globe Awards on Sunday as a platform to condemn Donald J. Trump. Moviedom power players mostly supported Hillary Clintons presidential campaign. Many stars openly telegraphed their disgust when Mr. Trump won instead. The president-elect has struggled to book A-list talent for his inauguration.

title: Far From the Bronx
description: The actor Andre Royo has become cozy in California.

title: A Familys Shared Defect Sheds Light on the Human Genome
description: They said it was their family curse: a rare congenital deformity called syndactyly, in which the thumb and index finger are fused together on one or both hands. Ten members of the extended clan were affected, and with each new birth, they told Stefan Mundlos of the Max Planck Institute for Molecular Genetics, the first question was always: How are the babys hands? Are they normal?

title: A Tour of Andre Royos Los Angeles Home
description: Age 48

title: What to Do About Your Neck
description: After nights spent sleeping on her side, Gigi Howard, a former public relations executive, would wake up with lines etched into her dcolletage. By day she wore scarves to hide the wrinkles. At night, she searched for a solution.

title: Up From the Family Basement, a Little-Seen Hamilton Trove
description: Starting on Wednesday, Hamil-fans will be able to enjoy a double dose of Americas newly favorite founding father: a public exhibition of a trove of documents held privately for more than two centuries by descendants of Alexander Hamilton, in a display at Sothebys designed by David Korins, the set designer for the musical Hamilton.

title: Review: One Piece Film: Gold, a Frantic Hunt for Pirate Loot
description: If youre not familiar with the anime franchise One Piece, based on Eiichiro Odas manga, youll be completely lost at its 13th cinematic entry, One Piece Film: Gold. The movie, directed by Hiroaki Miyamoto, doesnt provide a back story for its abundant characters. All you need to know is that the heroes, the Straw Hat pirates, are seagoing adventurers on a planet dominated by a world government. The pirates dont loot vessels; they simply seek lost treasure. (The series title comes from the name of a trove in the first installment.)

title: Airport-Shooting Victims: Volunteers and Entrepreneurs, Vacation Bound
description: MIAMI  One helped firefighters. Another volunteered at a local church. Two others ran businesses. They came from different cities, and most were starting vacations.

title: Golden Globe Awards, Fort Lauderdale: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: A Busy Week of Senate Hearings Before Trumps Inauguration
description: Nomination hearings, press conferences and other events scheduled this week.

title: Review: Blueprint Specials: What the Soldiers and Sailors May Have Seen in World War II Shows
description: For the first time, you dont have to be a member of the armed forces to see Blueprint Specials, a jaunty foray into a little-known footnote in American military history. A series of musicals intended to boost morale and entertain the troops during World War II, these forgotten shows (only four survive) have now been resurrected by the theater company Waterwell. The production  which combines elements of all of the extant shows  is being presented in association with (and on the hangar deck of) the Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum, as part of the Under the Radar festival.

title: Heres How Clemson Won the College Football Playoff Championship
description: Clemson upset Alabama and won the college football national championship, 35-31, in Tampa early Tuesday morning.

title: Review: Voices in Your Head, and a Sense of Being Trapped
description: Theater cant really do superheroes or massive natural catastrophes, so it must find more imaginative ways to suggest forces greater than we are. In Top Secret International (State 1), audience members hear voices, piped in via cordless headphones, that tell them where to go and what to do. In Real Magic, the actors themselves are stuck in a cosmic loop-de-loop, seemingly powerless to stop repeating their actions until they collapse from exhaustion  or we do.

title: Israel Buries 4 Soldiers, but the Mourning Is Marred by Discord
description: JERUSALEM  One loved horse riding; another was the oldest of four sisters; a third had fought to enlist in the army despite medical problems that allowed him to defer the draft. The fourth was the 300th  graduate of her Haifa high school to have died while serving as a soldier.

title: Review: At Globalfest, a World of Cultural Keepsakes With a Dance Beat
description: The singer Betsayda Machado was born in El Clavo, a village in central Venezuela that has maintained an Afro-Venezuelan Christmastime tradition called parranda: call-and-response songs driven by a flurry of percussion in brisk six-against-four rhythms. Her village group, Betsayda Machado y la Parranda el Clavo, has been together 30 years. Its New York City debut was a pure joy at Globalfest, the annual world-music showcase that brought a dozen groups to Webster Hall on Sunday.

title: Twin Peaks Reboot to Premiere in May
description: PASADENA, Calif.  At long last, Showtimes revival of Twin Peaks has a premiere date: Sunday, May 21, at 9 p.m. The season opener will be two hours long.

title: Can India Put an End to Identity Politics?
New York Citys Fire Deaths Reach Lowest Point in Over 100 Years
description: Forty-eight people died from fires in New York City last year, the fewest at any point in more than a century, Mayor Bill de Blasio said on Monday.

title: College Football Championship Highlights and Analysis
description: In a wild second half, Clemson scored with 1 second left in the game to stun Alabama, 35-31, and claim college footballs national championship.

title: Betsy DeVos, Trumps Education Pick, Plays Hardball With Her Wealth
description: After Tom Casperson, a Republican state senator from Michigans Upper Peninsula, began running for Congress in 2016, he assumed the family of Betsy DeVos, President-elect Donald J. Trumps nominee to be education secretary, would not oppose him.

title: Review: PWR BTTM Is Part Theater, Part Punk, Entirely Captivating
description: Ben Hopkins, with a printed dress slouching off his shoulder and caked-on glittery makeup covering his face, was explaining the genesis of his band PWR BTTM to the crowd at Joes Pub in the very small hours of Sunday morning.

title: Hall of Fame Odds Slip for Barry Bonds and Roger Clemens
description: The chances that Barry Bonds and Roger Clemens will soon be inducted into baseballs Hall of Fame have diminished somewhat in recent days as more writers have disclosed how they voted on the 2017 ballot.

title: Om Puri, a Film Actor Who Rose With the Indian New Wave, Dies at 66
description: NEW DELHI  Om Puri, one of the most acclaimed Indian actors of his generation, whose four-decade career included appearances in well-received British and American films, died on Friday at his home in Mumbai. He was 66.

title: Left Behind at a Bus Stop, but Not for Long
description: Dear Diary,

title: Arguably, the Worst Monday of the Year
description: It was cold and windy, gray and slushy. Half of New York City seemed to be sick with some sort of winter bug. The other half seemed in a mood.

title: Anonymous Bomb Threats Rattle Jewish Centers Across Eastern U.S.
description: The morning rush at the Jewish community center in Columbia, S.C., had subsided when the phone rang on Monday. The caller, an elderly-sounding woman, in a loud screaming voice kept saying theres a bomb, said Barry A. Abels, the centers executive director.

title: Critics Say Trump Appointees Can Dodge a Huge Tax Bill. Thats Not the Case.
description: Not only is Donald Trump giving a gang of billionaires control of our government, hes offering them a special tax break just for signing up.

title: Ryan Moore, Ryder Cup Standout, Finally Makes Most of His Promise
description: KAPALUA, Hawaii  When Ryan Moore defeated Lee Westwood to earn the clinching point for the United States in its victory over Europe at the Ryder Cup in October, the last thing on Moores mind was his golf ball.

title: Andrew Cuomo Raises His Profile, Stirring Talk of a 2020 Run
description: ALBANY  It had all the trappings of a presidential campaign rollout: the cheering crowd, the flag-draped stage, an appearance and a hearty endorsement from Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I am not saying theres no legal argument on the other side. Im just saying we have the better argument and will prevail.

title: American Destroyer Fires Warning Shots at Iranian Boats
description: WASHINGTON  In a vivid illustration of the tensions between the United States and Iran, an American Navy warship fired warning shots at Iranian boats that were racing toward it near the Strait of Hormuz, Defense Department officials said on Monday.

title: In Address, Cuomo Posits New Yorks Policies as an Answer to Trump
description: Delivering the first of six State of the State addresses planned around the state this week, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo on Monday located the cure to the nations political fever in New York State, implicitly offering himself as an antidote to a president-elect whose name went unmentioned.

title: For Many on Chicagos South Side, Obamas Farewell Will Be Personal
description: CHICAGO  If the metal barricades, Do Not Enter signs and lurking Secret Service agents were a bother the past eight years in the Hyde Park-Kenwood area  the South Side neighborhood where President Obama still owns a house, but rarely has been home  residents are not complaining.

title: Trump, Trapped in His Lies, Keeps Lying. Sad!
description: He hasnt taken office yet, but Donald Trump is lost, wandering in a labyrinth of lies and trying to drag the country in with him.

title: Odell Beckham Is Criticized by Jerry Reese and Ben McAdoo After Giants Loss
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Giants quarterback Eli Manning, Coach Ben McAdoo and General Manager Jerry Reese each censured wide receiver Odell Beckham Jr. in some manner Monday, a day after the Giants were eliminated from the N.F.L. playoffs in a 38-13 loss to the Packers.

title: Muted Response From Health Lobby as Affordable Care Act Faces Repeal
description: WASHINGTON  The speed of Republican efforts to repeal the Affordable Care Act has stunned health industry lobbyists, leaving representatives of insurance companies, hospitals, doctors and pharmaceutical makers in disarray and struggling for a response to a legislative quick strike that would upend much of the American health care system.

title: N.B.A. Fans Have Their Say on All-Stars. But Not the Only Say.
description: With the N.B.A. All-Star Game a little more than a month away, more than 11 million votes have already been cast to send fans favorite players to New Orleans.

title: Volkswagen Executives Trip to U.S. Allowed F.B.I. to Pounce
description: When F.B.I. agents learned that a prime suspect in the Volkswagen emissions scandal was traveling to the United States, investigators knew they were on the cusp of a rare feat: the arrest of an overseas corporate executive accused of wrongdoing.

title: Medicaids Data Gets an Internet-Era Makeover
description: Jini Kims relationship with Medicaid is business and personal.

title: Disc-Flipper
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Its always nice when you get more bang for your buck with a puzzle. Solving the puzzle itself is the main point, but who doesnt like a word ladder thrown in for good measure?

title: After Verizon Deal, Yahoo to Become Altaba and Marissa Mayer to Step Down From Board
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The fate of Yahoos $4.8 billion sale of its internet business to Verizon Communications may be uncertain. But in case it goes through, Yahoo has plans for what will remain.

title: Jared Kushner Will Sell Many of His Assets, but Ethics Lawyers Worry
description: After President-elect Donald J. Trump announced Monday that he would appoint his son-in-law, the real estate investor Jared Kushner, as a senior White House adviser, lawyers for Mr. Kushner said he would sell many of his assets to avoid myriad potential conflicts of interest.

title: With Derrick Rose Inexplicably Absent, Knicks Fall to Pelicans
description: Derrick Roses white No. 25 Knicks jersey hung from a coat hanger, pristine and unwrinkled. His Ace bandages were unwrapped and unrolled, still in their place. His locker was undisturbed.

title: Meryl Streep, Jared Kushner, Cristiano Ronaldo: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Rape, Fire and Death in Myanmar
description: Violence has forced an estimated 65,000 Rohingya to flee to Bangladesh from Myanmar since October.

title: There Are No Homes Left: Rohingya Tell of Rape, Fire and Death in Myanmar
description: KUTUPALONG CAMP, Bangladesh  When the Myanmar military closed in on the village of Pwint Phyu Chaung, everyone had a few seconds to make a choice.

title: Breitbarts Man in Rome: A Gentle Voice in a Strident Chorus
description: ROME  Rushing to meet his wife at St. Peters Square, Thomas Williams walked past priests in black cassocks and said that the only thing he missed from his own decades of wearing a priests collar was a real sense of helping people very directly.

title: Corrections: January 10, 2017
description: BUSINESS DAY

title: How to Prevent Gun Deaths? Where Experts and the Public Agree
description: Background checks? More concealed weapons? What about improving mental health care, or having better community outreach?

title: Clemson Upsets Alabama to Win the College Football Championship
description: TAMPA, Fla.  It began with a walk. Eight years ago, Dabo Swinney took over Clemsons football program as an interim head coach and instituted a pregame constitutional for his players before every home game, a Tiger Walk that sent the players through a mob of fans on their way into the stadium.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday: President Obamas Farewell and Tom Hardy in Taboo
description: President Obama gives what is expected to be the last speech of his administration. Being Mary Jane begins a new season with a new job in a new place. And Tom Hardy  in Taboo, a drama he created with his father  plays a shipping heir returned from the dead.

title: Scenes From Clemsons Victory in the College Football Playoff Championship
description: The Tigers beat Alabama, 35-31, in a game that featured a thrilling fourth quarter.

title: Word + Quiz: arable
Who Is Telling Africas Stories?
description: Easier access to digital equipment has led to a surge of local photographers, but not to more opportunities for aspiring photojournalists.

title: Dancers in Masks
description: Whats the story behind this photo?

title: Bannon Versus Trump
description: Its becoming clear that for the next few years American foreign policy will be shaped by the struggle among Republican regulars, populist ethno-nationalists and the forces of perpetual chaos unleashed by Donald Trumps attention span.

title: Republican Hypocrisy on Trumps Nominees
description: The Constitution and American tradition provide lots of ways for a president to exercise executive power.

title: The Untimely Death of an Iranian Pragmatist
description: Relations between the United States and Iran, which improved under President Obama to the point where the two sides were able to strike a nuclear deal, were already facing an uncertain future under Donald Trump, who has taken a tough line against Tehran. The death on Sunday of Ayatollah Ali Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani has increased this uncertainty. A moderate in Irans factional political struggles, Ayatollah Rafsanjani worked hard to soften its anti-Americanism and encourage constructive engagement with the West.

title: Russias D.N.C. Hack Was Only the Start
description: Imagine the headlines if, in 2015, Russian agents had leapt out of a van at 2 a.m. in Southeast Washington and broken into the Democratic National Committee offices using sophisticated tools and techniques to steal tens of thousands of documents, including the names and Social Security numbers of donors and employees, and confidential memorandums about campaign strategy for the presidential election.

title: The Fight for Health Care Has Begun
description: When House Republicans abandoned their plan to gut an independent ethics office last week, it showed the power of public opinion. It also offered a playbook for Democrats in 2017.

title: Big Worries About Betsy DeVos
description: The director of the Office of Government Ethics, the nonpartisan agency charged with vetting the financial disclosures of cabinet nominees for potential conflicts of interest, sent an extraordinary letter to Senate Democratic leaders late last week. Never in the four-decade history of the agency, he wrote, have ethics officials felt such undue pressure ... to rush through these important reviews, leaving some of the nominees with potentially unknown or unresolved ethics issues shortly before their scheduled hearings.

title: 1967: The Era of Big Battles in Vietnam
description: Lubbock, Tex.  By the beginning of 1967, there were 490,000 American troops in South Vietnam  along with some 850,000 from South Vietnam, South Korea and other allies  and Americas civilian and military leaders were starting to think big. This, they believed, would be the year to crush both the southerners fighting as the Viet Cong and their North Vietnamese allies, who had infiltrated the south.

title: Who Is Telling Africas Stories?
description: Akintunde Akinleye was at home one December morning in 2006 when a friend called him with urgent news. Hours earlier, a petroleum pipeline had exploded in a town outside Lagos, Nigeria, his home city, leaving more than 200 people dead. Hopping on his motorbike with his camera, Mr. Akinleye, a Reuters staff photographer based in Nigeria, swerved through miles of thick traffic and arrived on site in less than 30 minutes.

title: Questions for: A Month Without Sugar
description: Article: A Month Without Sugar

title: FIFA to Expand World Cup to 48 Teams in 2026
description: ZURICH  The World Cup will grow to 48 teams within a decade under a plan approved unanimously on Tuesday by FIFAs governing council, an enormous expansion of soccers showpiece tournament that was hailed by supporters as a victory for inclusion but that was derided by critics as the latest money grab by an organization still emerging from a series of financial scandals.

title: The Author of The Vegetarian Takes On Koreas Violent Past
description: HUMAN ACTSBy Han KangTranslated by Deborah Smith218 pp. Hogarth. $22.

title: What Will You Remember About President Obama and His Legacy?
description: President Obama leaves office on Jan. 20 after eight years. How will you remember our current president? What is his legacy, as both a man and as a leader?

title: Should We Trash Cash?
description: Two months ago, the worlds largest democracy embarked on one of the biggest monetary experiments the world has ever seen. On Nov. 8, without warning or preamble, without discussion papers or leaks, Narendra Modis Indian government invalidated most of the countrys cash. The 500- and 1,000-rupee notes  Indias two highest-denomination bills, then worth around $7.50 and $15, respectively  were, as of that moment, no longer legal tender. Anyone in possession of these notes had until Dec. 30 to take them to a bank and either deposit them or exchange them for other notes. Anyone presenting more than 250,000 rupees in cash ($3,700) had to provide an explanation for why he had so much, and proof that he had paid tax on it; the penalty for unpaid tax was to cough up 200 percent of the amount owed.

title: Beyond Santa Fe, a Different World
description: The first time I went to Santa Fe, I went out for a morning run and the city willed me to fall in love with it. The sunny sky, sweeping views and smell of the pinyon  the natural beauty captured my soul. That was three decades ago. I never stopped going back.

title: I Know How It Feels to Be Someones Token. Im Sure Ben Carson Does, Too.
description: The best people. This refrain rang throughout Donald Trumps presidential campaign; at times, it seemed to be his justification for being in the race at all. He wasnt a politician  he was a businessman. He had never run a government, but he ran a company, and running a company is, at bottom, easy: You get the best people. The pitch worked, and Trump will be sworn in as the 45th president of the United States of America. In the meantime, he has been stocking his cabinet with what he promises are the best people.

title: Trump Asks Critic of Vaccines to Lead Vaccine Safety Panel
description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., one of the nations most prominent skeptics of childhood vaccines, says President-elect Donald J. Trump has asked him to lead a vaccine panel.

title: President Dutertes List
description: President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines waved a thick sheaf of papers on live television, fanning the pages for the public and the national press corps to see. This list of names, this is it, he said in the Oct. 27 appearance. This is the drug industry in the Philippines.

title: The Lights Are On in Detroit
description: DETROIT  Just before the holidays, on a dark street a few blocks from downtown, a group of public officials crowded onto a makeshift stage before a shivering crowd, flipped a big switch  and the last of this citys 65,000 new streetlights blazed on.

title: Hearing Highlights: Sessions Questioned on Links to Xenophobia
description: Senator Jeff Sessions of Alabama offered assurances that he would be willing as attorney general to tell President-elect Donald J. Trump no and not be a mere rubber stamp.

title: Publishers Encounter Political Storms in Turn to Right
description: Milo Yiannopoulos  the infamous internet troll, Donald J. Trump supporter and editor at Breitbart News  has compared Islam to cancer, mocked transgender people and suggested that women who are harassed online should stay off the web. Last July, he was permanently barred from Twitter for violating the platforms rules against hate speech and harassment.

title: Trumps National Security Pick Sees Ally in Fight Against Islamists: Russia
description: WASHINGTON  Lt. Gen. Michael T. Flynn, President-elect Donald J. Trumps choice for national security adviser, traveled to Moscow about a year after he took charge of the Defense Intelligence Agency to cultivate what he saw as natural allies in the fight against Islamist militants: Russias spy agencies.

title: Trinity Mirror in Talks to Acquire Stake in Tabloid Publisher
description: LONDON  The publisher of The Daily Mirror, a left-wing British tabloid, said on Tuesday that it was in early-stage talks to acquire a minority stake in a new company that would include assets of the Northern & Shell Media Group, which publishes two rival right-wing tabloids, The Daily Express and The Daily Star.

title: President Obama, Jeff Sessions, Clemson: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Laughter Under the Midnight Sun

description: Altaba  thats the new name of the company that remains if Yahoo completes the sale of its internet business to Verizon (not to be confused with the scissors maker in Pakistan), according to a regulatory filing on Monday.

description: Updated, 9:17 a.m.

description: Happy New Year! How did you do on our 61-question quiz that reviewed all the top news of 2016?

title: Obama Races to Overhaul Police in Baltimore and Chicago Before Trump Era
description: BALTIMORE  With just days until Donald J. Trump is sworn in as president, the Obama administration is making a last-minute push for police overhauls in two of the nations most violent cities, Baltimore and Chicago, where officers have been accused of routinely mistreating African-Americans.

title: California Today: $8 Million in Tech Money for the Bay Area Arts
description: Good morning.

title: Alibaba Looks to Bricks and Mortar With Bid for Mall Operator in China
description: HONG KONG  Alibaba is pushing further into the very sector that it helped to disrupt with a $2.6 billion bid for Intime Retail, a department store and mall operator in China.

title: Michael Chamberlain, Father of Baby Killed by a Dingo in Australia, Dies at 72
description: It was a mystery that captivated Australia for years, inspired a Meryl Streep movie and tormented a couple for more than three decades.

title: As Protests Flare, Iran Bids Farewell to Rafsanjani
description: TEHRAN  Iranians bade farewell to Ayatollah Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani on Tuesday, with the sprawling state funeral veering slightly off script when groups of mourners started shouting opposition slogans.

title: Clemsons Title Was a Surprise. Just Not to Clemson.
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The fresh-faced Brandon Streeter looks much as he must have when he was starting at quarterback for Clemson in 1998 and 1999, seasons in which the Tigers went a combined 9-14.

title: There Will Be No Obamacare Replacement
description: You may be surprised at the evident panic now seizing Republicans, who finally  thanks to James Comey and Vladimir Putin  are in a position to do what they always wanted, and kill Obamacare. How can it be that theyre not ready with a replacement plan?

title: Can Donald Trump and Ral Castro Make a Good Deal?
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  Cuba operates as if it had two parties, President Ral Castro joked in his main report to the Seventh Congress of the Cuban Communist Party last April: Fidel leads one and I, the other.

title: China Wants to Be a Climate Change Watchdog, but Can It Lead by Example?
description: BEIJING  President-elect Donald J. Trump has called climate change a hoax created by China and said he would withdraw from the global Paris Agreement to curb greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Video and Analysis: Jeff Sessions Confirmation Hearing
description: Live coverage from Times reporters of the confirmation hearings in the Senate Judiciary Committee for Senator Jeff Sessions of Alabama, President-elect Donald J. Trumps nominee for attorney general.

title: Israel Museum Names Director
description: A year after James S. Snyder announced his decision to step down as director, the Israel Museum in Jerusalem has chosen his successor: Eran Neuman, currently the director of the David Azrieli School of Architecture at Tel Aviv University, will begin the position on Feb. 19.

title: Lining Up for Obama's Farewell Address
description: People waited in long lines in sub-zero wind chill temperatures outside McCormick Place to get tickets for President Obama's farewell speech.

title: Obamas Farewell Address: Yes, We Did
description: CHICAGO  President Obama delivered a nostalgic and hopeful farewell address to the nation on Tuesday evening, but warned both the divided country he led for eight years and his successor not to shrink from the challenges of economic inequality, racial strife, political isolation and voter apathy that still threaten its ideal of democracy.

title: Prisons Run by C.E.O.s? Privatization Under Trump Could Carry a Heavy Price
description: Last summer, the Justice Department decided to start winding down its use of private prisons.

title: Bombings Near Afghanistans Parliament Kill Dozens on Day of Assaults
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A double bombing by the Taliban near the Afghan Parliament office compound in Kabul on Tuesday killed dozens of people during the early-evening rush hour, officials said.

title: Under Pressure, Jeremy Corbyn Tries to Recalibrate His Image in U.K.
description: LONDON  Jeremy Corbyn, the leftist leader of Britains languishing Labour Party, went on a news media onslaught on Tuesday aimed at re-energizing his image and rebranding himself as more of a populist to try to allay fears among even his allies that the party is headed for a disastrous defeat in the next election.

title: Myanmars Shameful Denial
description: Last month, President Obama lifted sanctions against Myanmar, citing substantial progress in improving human rights following the historic election victory of the Nobel laureate Daw Aung San Suu Kyis National League for Democracy party in November 2015. Tragically, that praise is proving premature.

title: At-Home Wellness With Fiona Leahy
description: The event designer surrounds herself with objects that inspire good vibes.

title: How to Decompress, According to an In-Demand Party Planner
description: Inside the North London apartment of the event designer Fiona Leahy, even at midday, the hearth is ablaze, candles are lit and the heady scent of frankincense lingers in the air. I always like my house to smell like a big old church, says Leahy, who over the last decade has been employed by everyone from Christian Dior to Aerin Lauder to conjure experiences with that most intangible of commodities  atmosphere. The fragrance, the fire and the notable smattering of crystals are all part of a wellness routine that Leahy has evolved to better cope with the intensity of producing some of the fashion worlds most standout parties. Working in events is like being flung off a cliff, says the Irish native. When you go live, everything has to be absolutely perfect. Getting everything together takes a lot of energy. Theres a definite comedown from that.

title: Ethics Offices Letter on Betsy DeVos
description: In a letter to Senator Patty Murray, the ranking Democrat on the Health, Education, Labor and Pensions Committee, the Office of Government Ethics made it clear that a formal check on the pick for education secretary, Betsy DeVos, is far from complete.

title: WBGO Is Giving Jazz a Higher Profile Online
description: WBGO, the Newark public radio station, has long been one of the nations premier outlets for jazz on the air. Now it wants to be a destination for the music online as well.

title: Taran Killam Assumes the Throne in Hamilton
description: On Broadway, at least, everyone loves a pompous, thin-skinned autocrat. Its why Taran Killam couldnt be more excited to join Hamilton as King George, the blustery British monarch who, with a few memorable pop tunes, warns the upstart American colonists that theyll regret their revolutionary acts. The role, which Mr. Killam inherits from Rory OMalley (Jonathan Groff, Andrew Rannells and Brian dArcy James have also played the character), will be his Broadway debut when he begins on Jan. 17.

title: What 8 Culture Seekers Wore to the Public Theater
description: The Public Theater does more than put on plays. The nonprofit theater, housed in the former Astor Library in NoHo, also acts as a meeting place, a public forum, a writers brooder and a watering hole. On a recent Tuesday night, as icy winds whipped down Lafayette Street, the Public buzzed with cultural happenings. There was Tiny Beautiful Things, a play adapted from a Cheryl Strayed novel; two shows at Joes Pub (the astrologists Starsky and Cox, and the cabaret performer Justin Vivian Bond); and a meeting of the Young Presidents Organization at the Library, its intimate restaurant and bar. Here in their roost, a flock of culture vultures paraded their plumage.

title: Clare Hollingworth, Reporter Who Broke News of World War II, Dies at 105
description: From a single gust of wind, Clare Hollingworth reaped the journalistic scoop of the century.

title: La La Land Picks Up 11 Bafta Nominations
description: The frothy musical La La Land continued its run as an awards favorite on Tuesday, picking up 11 nominations from the EE British Academy Film Awards, but there were surprises in the competition, familiarly known as the Baftas: The extraterrestrial drama Arrival and Nocturnal Animals, Tom Fords twisty tale-within-a-tale, drew nine nominations apiece.

title: Becoming a Confident College Student, With the Help of an Angel
description: The police came to the door on the familys cleaning day. Julio Reyes, then 13, remembers that the apartment was spotless; his mother was a stickler for cleanliness.

title: A Bumblebee Gets New Protection on Obamas Way Out
description: The Obama administration, rushing to secure its environmental legacy, has increased protection for a humble bumblebee.

title: Not She Said, He Said. Mockery, Plain and Simple.
description: It was late November 2015, and Donald J. Trump was about to make a callous gesture that follows him to this day. Before a crowd gathered at a Myrtle Beach convention center, the candidate hoisted one hand up, flailed his arms and mocked a New York Times reporter who has a physical disability that almost precisely mirrors Trumps movements that evening.

title: Roman Herzog, Germanys President in 1990s, Is Dead at 82
description: Roman Herzog, who as Germanys second president after reunification called for confidence and joie de vivre during a time of economic malaise, died on Tuesday in Bad Mergentheim, Germany. He was 82.

title: Russian Hackers Gained Limited Access to R.N.C., Comey Says
description: WASHINGTON  The director of the F.B.I., James B. Comey, told lawmakers at a Senate hearing on Tuesday that Russian hackers had penetrated the Republican National Committees computer records, but he called it a limited penetration of old R.N.C. computer systems that were no longer in use.

title: Transcript: Jeff Sessionss Prepared Remarks at His Attorney General Hearing
description: Senator Jeff Sessions, Republican of Alabama, appeared in front of the Senate Judiciary Committee on Tuesday for a confirmation hearing on his nomination for attorney general. Following are his opening remarks, as prepared for delivery, and released by the presidential transition team.

title: Giving Back a Stolen Property to the Original Manhattanites
description: The squat clapboard house overlooking the Hudson River in the West Village might not seem like an obvious place for a Native American prayer center.

title: Piers 92 and 94 to Stand Out at the Armory Show
description: Keen to distinguish the Armory Show, which is facing competition from almost 300 other contemporary art fairs around the world, the New York art fairs executive director, Benjamin Genocchio, is playing up the gritty industrial space of Piers 92 and 94 on the Hudson River.

title: How to Take Part in Inauguration Weekend
description: On Friday, Jan. 20, around noon, President-elect Donald J. Trump will take the oath of office on the West Lawn of the United States Capitol in Washington, D.C., to become the 45th president of the United States; Vice President-elect Mike Pence will be sworn in before Mr. Trump. The occasion marks the countrys 58th presidential inauguration (George Washington was the first president to be sworn in, on April 20, 1789).

title: A Ski Resort Grows Under an Expansive Montana Sky
description: BIG SKY, Mont.  Stephen Kircher has fond memories of the first time he visited Big Sky Resort, in 1976. A native of Michigan, he traveled to Montana on a reconnaissance mission with his family, the owners of Boyne Resorts. Having passed on opportunities to buy Telluride Ski Resort in Colorado and Jackson Hole Mountain Resort in Wyoming, his father, Everett, was considering adding Big Sky Resort to the companys growing portfolio.

title: Maria Sharapova to Return From Suspension at April Event in Germany
description: On April 25, Maria Sharapova will be forbidden to set foot on the grounds of the Porsche Tennis Grand Prix in Stuttgart, Germany, still barred for a 2016 doping violation. The next day, she will be the star attraction there.

title: Muslim Girls in Switzerland Must Attend Swim Classes With Boys, Court Says
description: In 2008, school officials in Basel, Switzerland, ordered a Muslim couple to enroll their daughters in a mandatory swimming class, despite the parents objections to having their girls learn alongside boys.

title: Fox News Settled Sexual Harassment Allegations Against Bill OReilly, Documents Show
description: In the weeks after Roger Ailes was ousted as the chairman of Fox News in July amid a sexual harassment scandal, company executives secretly struck an agreement with a longtime broadcast personality who had come forward with similar accusations about the networks top host, Bill OReilly.

title: Daily Report: Big Data Comes to the Medicaid Debate
description: Like so much in Washington, those partaking in the impending debate over Medicaid costs may lose sight of the facts. But thats not to say the facts wont be available.

title: Artist Charged With Trespassing in Hollyweed Sign Prank
description: A man who admitted changing the Hollywood sign to Hollyweed has turned himself in to the authorities.

title: Despite Shootings and Zika, Florida Tourism Remains Strong
description: It hasnt been an easy eight months for Florida. On June 12, an attack in an Orlando nightclub killed 49 people. In July, the Zika virus surfaced in Miamis Wynwood neighborhood and eventually spread to other parts of the city, causing panic among residents and tourists. And on Jan. 6, a gunman opened fire at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport, leaving at least five people dead.

title: Clive Barnes Award Winners Are Announced
description: The seventh annual Clive Barnes Awards, which honor outstanding young performers in theater and dance, were announced on Monday at the Walter Reade Theater at Lincoln Center. The award for theater, presented by Joel Grey, went to Khris Davis for his performance in The Royale at the Mitzi E. Newhouse Theater. The award for dance, presented by the New York City Ballet principal Ashley Bouder, was given to Indiana Woodward, also of City Ballet; Ms. Woodwards new roles in 2016 included the title role in the companys La Sylphide.

title: HarperCollins Pulls Book by a Trump Pick After Plagiarism Report
description: HarperCollins is withdrawing the digital edition of Monica Crowleys 2012 book What the (Bleep) Just Happened? from retailers, after evidence of plagiarism.

title: Sentenced to Death: A Look at Dylann Roofs Rampage and Its Aftermath
description: Update: A federal jury has unanimously sentenced Dylann S. Roof to die. The white supremacist showed no remorse for killing nine members of a black church in South Carolina. Read more

title: Watch PBS Shows Online or Off
description: Q. I dont have a cable television subscription but I want to watch shows on PBS. As this is a taxpayer-funded service, shouldnt all the shows be free to get online without cable?

title: Transgender Women Fear Abuse in Immigration Detention
description: PHOENIX  Nina Chaubal and her wife, Greta Martela, thought about going through the Rocky Mountains on their way to Chicago from San Diego late last month, but did not want to risk getting caught in a snowstorm. So they drove south through Arizona, where Ms. Chaubal, an Indian national with an invalid work visa, fell into the hands of the Border Patrol.

title: Jeff Sessions Says He Would Be Independent and Stand Up to Trump
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Jeff Sessions, President-elect Donald J. Trumps nominee for attorney general, pledged on Tuesday to say no to Mr. Trump if he tries to go beyond the law, and he spoke out against torture, a ban on Muslim immigration and other ideas that had been floated by Mr. Trump.

title: Bostons Colonial Theater Gets a New Lease on Life
description: Bostons historic Colonial Theater, which recently faced the possibility of teardown, will join the Ambassador Theater Group roster. The 117-year-old theater will undergo a multimillion dollar renovation before reopening in 2018, and Ambassador executives say they hope the theater will once again become a destination for shows heading to Broadway.

title: Harvey Spevak, C.E.O. of Equinox, Has a Sporty Style
description: Harvey Spevak, the chief executive of the Equinox fitness company, goes with a sleek, sporty look. When Mr. Spevak, 52, isnt hosting opening parties for new locations for Equinox and its brands SoulCycle and Blink, the Bronx-born Manhattan resident is working on one of the companys latest projects: an Equinox hotel scheduled to open in Hudson Yards in New York in spring 2019.

title: Thousands Mourn at Rafsanjani Funeral in Tehran
description: Thousands of people gathered on the streets of Tehran to mourn the death of Ayatollah Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani, whose funeral took place on Tuesday. Mr. Rafsanjani died Sunday at age 82.

title: For Knicks, Professionalism Was Missing Way Before Derrick Rose Was
description: There are innumerable ways to bail on workplace responsibility without permission or an acceptable excuse. And for the better part of the 21st century, the Knicks have been a virtual home office for creative, dismissive acts of unaccountability.

title: Former Top Justice Dept. Lawyer to Join Morrison & Foerster
description: John P. Carlin, who was the Justice Departments top national security lawyer, has moved to the law firm Morrison & Foerster to lead its global risk and crisis management practice, the firm announced on Tuesday.

title: Chief Executive of Audio Firm Sonos Steps Down
description: SEATTLE  Over the years, Sonos has weathered competition from better known rivals like Apple and Bose to find a devoted audience among audio enthusiasts. But lately its wireless speaker has lost ground to an unexpected competitor, Amazons Echo.

title: Deadpool Makes the Producers Guild List of Nominees
description: La La Land, Manchester by the Sea and Moonlight, three films that have been pulling in top honors all awards season, were among the Producers Guild Award nominees announced Tuesday. The list of 10 also included Deadpool, which was a huge hit at the box office but not so much among prize-givers.

title: Roy Innis, Black Activist With a Right-Wing Bent, Dies at 82
description: Roy Innis, the autocratic national leader of the Congress of Racial Equality since 1968, whose right-wing views on affirmative action, law enforcement, desegregation and other issues put him at odds with many black Americans and other civil rights leaders, died on Sunday in Manhattan. He was 82.

title: Trump Tells Congress to Repeal and Replace Health Care Law Very Quickly
description: President-elect Donald J. Trump demanded on Tuesday that Congress immediately repeal the Affordable Care Act and pass another health law quickly. His remarks put Republicans in the nearly impossible position of having only weeks to replace a health law that took nearly two years to pass.

title: White House Urges Research on Geoengineering to Combat Global Warming
description: A White House road map for federally funded climate research has for the first time recommended research into geoengineering, the concept of intervening in nature to slow or reverse global warming.

title: Rye Returns
description: The hearty grain makes a resurgence in the modern kitchen

title: Rye, a Grain With Ancient Roots, Is Rising Again
description: Any adventurous eater who has wandered into the woods of modern Nordic cuisine has probably tripped over a loaf of rye bread. There is wonderfully chewy rugbrod at Great Northern Food Hall in Grand Central Terminal, spice-scented Swedish limpa at Plaj in San Francisco, and darkly rugged toast at Bachelor Farmer in Minneapolis.

title: Your Morning Briefing: Rafsanjani, Donald Trump, Kabul
description: Good morning.

title: Dylann Roof Is Sentenced to Death in Charleston Church Massacre
description: Note: This is a story from 2017. Now the police are trying to end the notoriety of gunmen in shootings.

title: HTTPS on NYTimes.com
description: We are thrilled to announce that we have begun to enable HTTPS on NYTimes.com, an effort that helps protect the privacy of our readers and ensures the authenticity of our content. This is a significant milestone in the 21-year history of our website, and though its taken us some time, we are very excited to share this with our readers.

title: London Mens Roundup
description: J.W. Anderson, Grace Wales Bonner, Fashion East and more from London Fashion Week Mens.

title: Comfort and Nostalgia for a Rainy Week of Mens Wear in London
description: LONDON  Given the recent upheavals in the British fashion industry, and in Britain itself, it was perhaps not much of a surprise that many of the 120 designers who showed their goods during the four-day event that closed here on Monday took their inspiration from notions of comfort and nostalgia.

title: Volkswagen Set to Plead Guilty and to Pay U.S. $4.3 Billion in Deal
description: Volkswagen is on the verge of pleading guilty to criminal charges and paying $4.3 billion in fines, in a deal that would resolve a federal criminal investigation into its cheating on vehicle emissions tests, the automaker said on Tuesday.

title: Steven McDonald, Paralyzed Officer Who Championed Forgiveness, Dies at 59
description: Steven McDonald, a New York City police officer who was shot by a 15-year-old boy in Central Park in July 1986 and paralyzed from the neck down, but who forgave his assailant, hoped for the youths redemption and remained in the public eye for his spirit in the face of adversity, died on Tuesday in Manhasset, N.Y. He was 59.

title: Gang Database Criticized for Denying Due Process May Be Used for Deportations
description: LOS ANGELES  Peter Arellano was standing on the street with his father last year when an officer from the Los Angeles Police Department handcuffed him, supposedly for vandalism a few blocks away. Before asking him for any information about the incident, the police officer asked him for his gang moniker, Mr. Arellano said. He told the officer he had none. But moments later, Mr. Arellano was served with a gang injunction, restricting where he could go in public and with whom.

title: At Sundance, the Theme Is Climate Change
description: LOS ANGELES  It certainly reads like a political statement: Next week, one day before Donald J. Trump takes the presidential oath of office, the Sundance Film Festival will open its 33rd edition with a climate-change documentary starring Al Gore.

title: Chan Zuckerberg Initiative Builds Political Muscle for Philanthropic Work
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg and his wife, Dr. Priscilla Chan, have vowed to put their enormous wealth toward philanthropic causes. Now the couple are putting infrastructure in place to make sure their money and efforts will make an impact on policy as well.

title: Men in Womens Jobs
description: To the Editor:

title: China and the Ivory Trade
description: To the Editor:

title: How Valeant Had a Bright Idea but Took It Too Far
description: Valeant Pharmaceuticals Internationals failed strategy had a grain of sense at its center. Drug makers spend over $50 billion a year on research and development, but the payoff keeps declining. Valeant tried to address the problem by acquiring companies, slashing research outlays and jacking up prices to keep the top line growing. But its aggressive approach backfired.

title: What Liberals Can Learn From the Tea Partys Success
description: To the Editor:

title: Derrick Rose Returns to Knicks and Explains His Absence
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Derrick Rose returned to the Knicks on Tuesday after a confusing day away from the team that left his teammates and club executives concerned about his well-being.

title: Gay Veteran, 91, Gets Honorable Discharge After 69 Years
description: For more than half a century, Hubert Edward Spires has lived with the painful memory of being kicked out of the Air Force as a young gay sergeant in the 1940s. The word undesirable was printed on his discharge records.

title: Time to Grill Rex Tillerson on Climate Change
description: The dominant issues at Wednesdays hearing on the nomination of Rex Tillerson, the former chief executive of Exxon Mobil, for secretary of state are likely to be Mr. Tillersons ties to Russian president Vladimir Putin and any potential conflicts of interest arising from Exxons extensive global operations. But members of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee will be sadly delinquent if they do not press him on the issue of climate change.

title: SoftBanks $100 Billion Investment Fund Starts to Take Shape
description: Many business titans have made the trek to Trump Tower for a private audience with Donald J. Trump since he was elected president, but none have made a bigger splash than Masayoshi Son, the billionaire telecommunications entrepreneur.

title: Flora Bar
description: Small plates hold court at Ignacio Mattoss latest spot in the Met Breuer museum.

title: The Art of Flavor at Flora Bar in the Met Breuer
description: Im on the verge of giving up trying to explain why Ignacio Mattoss food is so good.

title: Dining In at the Met Breuer
description: Pete Wells, restaurant critic for The Times, visits Flora Bar, a new restaurant and cafe on the lower level of the Met Breuer. We take a look inside on a snowy Saturday.

title: The Hearings on Trumps Nominees Begin
description: To the Editor:

title: Womens March on Washington: What You Need to Know
description: Many thousands of people are expected to march in protest of the new president on Jan. 21, his first full day in office.

title: Lon Baras Fall/Winter 2017 Collection
description: A look at the new British brand, which debuted during London Collections: Men last weekend.

title: Brand to Know: The British Mens Wear Line Aiming for Function
description: For the designers Omar Afridi and Hugo Edwards, good mens wear should be about making a mans everyday life just a little bit easier. Thats the idea behind their new London-based brand, Lon Bara, which aims to offer practical clothes.

title: Street Style: London Fashion Week Mens
description: Some favorite looks from the citys sidewalks between the collection shows.

title: Street Style: London Fashion Week Mens
description: London Fashion Week Mens ended on Monday. Here are some of our favorite looks spotted between the collection shows.

title: DAmato Removed From Plane After Urging Walkout Over Delays
description: Alfonse M. DAmato, a former United States senator, has given many speeches in his day, trying to rouse his peers into action. Not all have worked.

title: Supreme Court Blocks Special Elections in North Carolina
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Tuesday blocked a trial courts ruling ordering special elections in North Carolina that would have truncated the terms of many lawmakers in the state.

title: The Unlikely Artists Behind This Seasons Most Colorful Show
description: Gallery exhibitions in New York can sometimes feel like a continual recycling of the same few dozen artists names. But this week, Geary Contemporary in the West Village offers an antidote: a coupling of works by artists who operate well outside the cliquish gallery sphere. The show features paintings by Charles Andresen, who has worked for the Metropolitan Museum for 25 years  20 of them as a security officer  and ceramic works by Jerry Torre, the former caretaker of Grey Gardens, who appeared in the 1975 documentary about Edith Beale (Big Edie) and her daughter, also named Edie, who were relatives of Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis. (Torre worked at the house as a teenager, and the younger Edie nicknamed him  for reasons that remain unclear to all involved  The Marble Faun, after the Nathaniel Hawthorne novel.)

title: Will Shortz: Meet the Puzzle Master!
