title: At Home With Barack and Michelle
description: CHICAGO  Edith Williams opened the door to her condo in Chicagos Woodlawn neighborhood and welcomed me into her living room. You should know, I dont have a velvet Jesus on the wall, she said, laughing.

title: Hey, Steve Harvey, Who Says I Might Not Steal Your Girl?
description: The book was a gift, a dark joke uncovered on Amazon, purchased by one co-worker for another. I saw it while fumbling through invoices in the office: How to Date a White Woman: A Practical Guide for Asian Men.

title: I Had a 9 Percent Chance. Plus Hope.
description: Before I got cancer, I used to collect $2 bills. They were rare, and I thought that meant they were lucky, but rare and lucky are not the same thing.

title: Why Trump Cant Make It 1981 Again
description: As if Donald J. Trumps victory wasnt surprising enough, the economic reaction has been even more stunning. Despite forecasts of a stock market meltdown if he won, the market registered one of its strongest postelection rallies in more than a century. Now the euphoria is spilling into the wider economy, with business confidence skyrocketing and consumer confidence hitting a 15-year high. Much of this excitement is inspired by a growing consensus that Mr. Trump could be the most-business friendly president since Ronald Reagan.

title: Haunted by Vietnam
description: Half a century later, readers recall the pain and destruction on the battlefield and off.

title: New Path to the N.H.L.: Crunching Numbers, Not Opponents
description: In a busy 2014 off-season during which the Toronto Maple Leafs hired Brendan Shanahan as club president in an overhauling of their front office, one of the teams biggest moves was among its most discreet. That eventful summer ended with Darryl Metcalf joining Torontos advanced stats group.

title: The Linguistic Labyrinth of Arabic News
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  As the Syrian government took back eastern Aleppo from the rebels in December, the story you heard in the Arab world about what was happening largely depended on where you got your news.

title: Marcelo Burlon County of Milan: Mens Collection
description: The latest mens designs from the label.

title: That Time the K.G.B. Slipped Me Vodka
description: For those of us who worked in the old Soviet Union as reporters or diplomats, all the talk of kompromat and dezinformatsiya that has emerged with the Trump dossier  unverified  has been a blast from what we thought was a distant past.

title: With the Tennis Season Beginning, a Wish List for 2017
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Tennis got more than its share of undesirable events in 2016: Roger Federers first surgery, Maria Sharapovas  suspension for a doping violation, the knife attack on Petra Kvitova that left the future of her career in doubt.

title: Moschino: Mens Collection
description: The latest mens designs from the label.

title: Justice Dept. Releases Report on Chicago Police
description: The Justice Department issued a report on Friday that cited systemic civil rights abuses by the Chicago Police Department. The findings come as the department tries to overhaul nearly two dozen police departments nationwide.

title: UConn Women Win Their 91st Straight and Rewrite History Again
description: All that was missing from the Connecticut womens basketball teams shattering of its own N.C.A.A.-record winning streak on Saturday was a sense of drama and amazement.

title: Grammar Lesson
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  When I was in school, I was O.K. with grammar when we were talking about your basic nouns, verbs and adjectives. I was even O.K. with present tense, past tense and future tense. Once they started to rattle on about split indicative predicates with a triple axel and a shot of mocha, however, I decided it was time to stop listening and just write. It was incredibly freeing.

title: Falcons Take Advantage of Seattles Stumble and Race to N.F.C. Title Game
description: ATLANTA  In the playoffs, when the best teams meet, games are often decided by a mistake here or there, or a penalty called or not called. Under Coach Pete Carroll, the Seattle Seahawks have built a reputation of minimizing those mistakes and forcing their opponents to make them instead.

title: Pruitt v. EPA: 14 Challenges of EPA Rules by the Oklahoma Attorney General
description: Oklahoma Attorney General Scott Pruitt has repeatedly sued the Environmental Protection Agency to try to block Obama administration rules intended to protect the nation's air and water. In all but one of these 14 cases, regulated industry players also were parties.

title: When He Goes Low, They Go  Where? Democrats Mull How to Confront Trump
description: PHOENIX  As the candidates for chairman of the Democratic National Committee gathered here for a forum on Saturday, they wrestled with a vexing question: how to confront the asymmetrical political warfare of President-elect Donald J. Trump.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I remember thinking, They are going to hate us one day. I knew that we couldnt do everything that people wanted to meet those expectations.

title: Corrections: January 15, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Prison Riot in Brazil Leaves at Least 10 Inmates Dead
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  At least 10 prisoners have been killed in a prison riot in northeastern Brazil, the latest in a wave of fatal uprisings in the countrys overcrowded prisons that have killed nearly 100 this year  with many of the victims decapitated and mutilated.

title: Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus to End Its 146-Year Run
description: Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey circus announced on Saturday night that after 146 years of performances, it was folding its big tent forever.

title: Patriots Beat Texans to Reach Sixth Straight A.F.C. Title Game
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  The New England Patriots have accomplished so much under Coach Bill Belichick and quarterback Tom Brady, but they found something new to achieve on Saturday night at Gillette Stadium. In outlasting the Houston Texans, 34-16, the Patriots set an N.F.L. record for conference dominance and used a rare performance by a running back to get it.

title: Aaron Rodgers Connects With His Hometown, but the Family Huddle Is Broken
description: CHICO, Calif.  As flood advisories were issued here last Sunday, patrons at the End Zone Bar & Grill  who braved slick, debris-strewn roads to watch an N.F.L. playoff game together  had something more distressing on their minds. The bars big-screen TVs showed the Green Bay Packers offense, commanded by Aaron Rodgers, Chicos native son and favorite quarterback, clogging like a storm drain.

title: Derika Jaffe, Philip Rosenthal
description: Derika Brooke Jaffe and Philip Jeffrey Rosenthal are to be married Jan. 15 at the Park Avenue Synagogue in Manhattan. Rabbi Daniel Sherman is to officiate.

title: Rebecca Rindler, Amos Berger
description: Rebecca May Falk Rindler and Amos Kalman Berger are to be married Jan. 15 at the Green Building, an event space in Brooklyn. Shira Kline, who was ordained by the Open Ministry and is the director of worship and a ritual leader at Lab/Shul, is to lead a progressive Jewish ceremony.

title: Jennifer Grausman, Andy Schocken
description: Jennifer Grausman and Andy Schocken, both filmmakers, are to be married Jan. 15 by Rabbi Melissa Buyer-Witman at the Lotos Club in New York.

title: Lauren Liebes, Jonathan Cabin
description: Lauren Carly Liebes and Dr. Jonathan Ari Cabin are to be married Jan. 15 in Pocantico Hills, N.Y. Cantor Josh Konigsberg is to officiate at Blue Hill at Stone Barns.

title: Neil Cohen, Paul Wolfson
description: Neil William Cohen and Paul Reinherz Quitman Wolfson are to be married Jan. 15 in the Washington chambers of Cornelia T. L. Pillard, a judge on the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit.

title: Lindsay Smith, Jason Davidman
description: Lindsay Michelle Smith and Jason Howard Davidman are to be married Jan. 15 at Glen Island Harbour Club in New Rochelle, N.Y. Rabbi Jonathan Hecht is to officiate.

title: Hadass Blank, Ryan Kurtis
description: Hadass Levy Blank and Ryan Joel Kurtis are to be married Jan. 15 in Rye, N.Y. Rabbi Tom Weiner is to officiate at Whitby Castle, a restaurant and event space at Rye Golf Club.

title: Celeste Pollicino, Benjamin Rose
description: Celeste Elefante Pollicino and Benjamin Chad Rose were married on Jan. 14 at the Essex House in New York.

title: Amira Beeber, Michael Burke
description: Amira Sharon Beeber, a daughter of Linda Barash Beeber and Dr. Bruce J. Beeber of Atlanta, is to be married Jan. 15 to Michael George Burke, a son of Bella A. Kaufman and Leo G. Burke of San Diego. Rabbi Laurence Rosenthal is to lead the ceremony, with Rabbi Yossi Lerman participating, at the Ahavath Achim Synagogue in Atlanta, where the bride is a fourth-generation member.

title: Brett Amelkin, Joseph Newman
description: Brett Sloane Amelkin and Joseph Craig Newman were married Jan. 14 at the Addison, an event space in Boca Raton, Fla. Ian Marcus Amelkin, the brides brother who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at a ceremony incorporating Jewish traditions.

title: Rebecca Bayard, Michael Hedrick
description: Rebecca Anna Maria Bayard, the daughter of Eliane C. Bayard and Henri P. Bayard of Port-au-Prince, Haiti, was married Jan. 14 to Michael Robert Hedrick, the son of Roberta J. Hedrick and John R. Hedrick of Glenview, Ill. The Rev. Megan Smith of Coral Gables Congregational Church in Coral Gables, Fla., performed the ceremony there, with Msgr. Joseph Lafontant, bishop of Port-au-Prince, taking part.

title: Laura Kolar, Valentin Todorov
description: Laura Elin Kolar, a daughter of Christine A. Kolar and Barry R. Kolar of Baltic, Conn., was married Jan. 14 to Valentin Todorov, the son of Ella Todorov of Albrightsville, Pa., and Gennady Krechner of Southampton, Pa. The Very Rev. Andrii Pokotylo performed the ceremony at St. Marys Ukrainian Orthodox Church in New Britain, Conn.

title: Kate Nocera, Michael Case
description: Kate Nocera and Michael Andrew Case were married Jan. 14 at the Blue Heron Restaurant in Sunderland, Mass. Ann Horwitz Dubin, a Universal Life minister and a friend of the couple, officiated.

title: Amy Tidovsky, James McDuffie
description: Amy Lynn Tidovsky and James Baggett McDuffie were married Jan. 14 at Tableau, a restaurant in New Orleans. The Rev. Donald K. McDowell, a Universal Life minister who is a friend of the couple, officiated.

title: Billy Porter, Adam Smith
description: Billy Porter, the son of Cloerinda Ford of Englewood, N.J., and the late William E. Porter of Pittsburgh, was married Jan. 14 to Adam Smith, a son of Samilou Smith and Joe W. Smith of Searcy, Ark. MaryMartha Ford-Dieng, Mr. Porters sister, who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated at the home of Lynn and Harvey Ravner in New York.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: The Young Pope, Victoria and Homeland
description: Call it Vatican of Cards: The Young Pope is sometimes so bad its almost good, our critic says. Meanwhile, Victoria, for all its pleasures, isnt the least bit believable, as historical dramas go. And Homeland brings a note of comfort in troubling times.

title: Donald Trump News Conference Gets the S.N.L. Treatment
description: If Donald J. Trumps first news conference as president-elect was a raucous, chaotic affair on Wednesday  and it was  the parody of it on Saturday Night Live was somehow calmer and more organized than the actual event.

title: You Draw It: What Got Better or Worse During Obamas Presidency
description: See if youre as smart as you think you are.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $1 Million
description: 1177 Hardscrabble Road, Chappaqua

title: In Davos, Bracing for a Shifting U.S. Stance on Climate Change
description: LONDON  However slowly and tentatively, nations around the globe appear to be taking some steps to confront the growing threat of climate change.

title: 52 Places to Go: Madagascar
description: Madagascar is known for its abundant and diverse wildlife. Have a close encounter with some lemurs, who exist only in Madagascar and the surrounding islands.

title: Trump, Davos, Martin Luther King Jr.: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Trade in the Trump Era: The Politics of Resentment
description: WASHINGTON  Ahead of Davos, The New York Timess deputy Washington editor, Jonathan Weisman, sat down to talk trade in the Trump era with Pietra Rivoli, a professor at Georgetown University who teaches finance and international business. She is the author of an award-winning book on international trade, The Travels of a T-Shirt in the Global Economy. Following is a condensed and edited version of the conversation.

title: Patriots (Ho-Hum) Win Again. Dion Lewis (Who?) Shows the Way.
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  ts funny how different kinds of athletes celebrate success. In baseball, when a team advances to the league championship series, the players turn the locker room into a nightclub  music and dancing in a raucous blizzard of alcohol. Its all a bit much, but no more peculiar, perhaps, than the scene at Gillette Stadium late Saturday night.

title: Runaway Teenager Slowly Reveals Tale of Horrors While Away
description: Almost two years ago, a young man stopped on a sidewalk at the South Street Seaport and attached a sign to a pole with duct tape. Missing, it read, above a picture of his smiling sister, Joannie, who was 17. Possibly dyed hair (red).

title: Salvatore Ferragamo: Mens Collection
description: The label shows their fall 2017 designs.

title: Bahrain Executes 3 Shiites Convicted in Deadly Attack on Police
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Bahrain executed by firing squad on Sunday three Shiite men convicted of killing three police officers in a bombing in 2014.

title: World Leaders Push Israel and Trump to Forge a 2-State Deal
description: PARIS  An effort by France to give impetus to the stalled Israeli-Palestinian peace process through an international conference always faced long odds. But with an incoming American president who has vowed to support Israel no matter what, the project seemed even more quixotic.

title: Maintaining a Sunny Spirit in the Face of Hardship
description: Laughter saved Linda Ragoos face.

title: U.K. Set to Choose Sharp Break From European Union
description: LONDON  If British plans for leaving the European Union have been a dance of the seven veils, the British government removed one of them on Sunday, letting slip to news media that Prime Minister Theresa May is likely to choose to exit Europes single market and its customs union  a so-called hard Brexit.

title: A Camden Address With a Link to Martin Luther King Jr.
description: Jeanette Lilly Hunt was 18 when her father-in-law rented a room in his Camden, N.J., home to two students who were studying across the Delaware River at the Crozer Theological Seminary.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Sunnei: Mens Collection
description: The latest mens designs from the label.

title: Yellow Cab, Long a Fixture of City Life, Is for Many a Thing of the Past
description: John McFadden no longer sticks his hand out for a yellow cab. He has plenty of other options at his fingertips.

title: From Rough Draft to Exhibition: Outsiders Art Is (Finally) Revealed
description: Typist wanted, the classified ad said. This was in the 1940s, when college students like Mark Heming placed ads like that to turn the rough drafts of their term papers into something. The typist looked through the pages he handed her and asked: Who are these faces?

title: One Hand on Light Switch, Obama Isnt Flipping to Off Just Yet
description: WASHINGTON  Just days before Donald J. Trump raises his hand to take the oath of office, police departments in Chicago and Baltimore have agreed to federal overhauls, Cubans no longer have an easy route to residency in the United States, and new civil rights monuments in Alabama and South Carolina are on the books.

title: Missoni: Mens Collection
description: The labels mens collection.

title: British Firms Await Brexit Plans, Poised to Relocate
description: READING, England  With its state-of-the-art robotics, Magal Engineerings factory in the colorless outskirts of this busy commercial town west of London is an important component of Britains booming car industry, churning out millions of sophisticated vehicle parts every year.

title: Repeal and Replace: Words Still Hanging Over G.O.P.s Health Care Strategy
description: WASHINGTON

title: DirecTVs Local N.F.L. Blackout Brings Out Angry Rob Lowe
description: Rob Lowe has appeared in nearly a dozen DirecTV commercials.

title: Womens March Gives Boost to Start-Up for Bus Sharing
description: A few days after Donald J. Trump won the presidential election, the founders of Skedaddle, a bus start-up, began seeing some unusual activity.

title: Death Toll From Brazil Prison Riot Reaches 26; Decapitations Are Seen
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The death toll from a riot in a penitentiary in northeastern Brazil rose on Sunday to 26 prisoners, increasing the number of prison killings in the country this year to more than 120.

title: Catterbox Appealed to Owners Fondest Wish: A Chat With Tabby
description: For months there has been excitement among the cat cognoscenti about the Catterbox, described in a viral video as the worlds first talking cat collar.

title: Tony Rosato, of 1981-82 Saturday Night Live Cast, Dies at 62
description: Tony Rosato, who was a cast member of the sketch shows Saturday Night Live and SCTV in the 1980s, but whose career ground to a halt when mental illness led to his incarceration in the 2000s, died on Tuesday at his home in Toronto. He was 62.

title: In Texas, a Test of Whether the Voting Rights Act Still Has Teeth
description: PASADENA, Tex.  Within days of the Supreme Court striking down the heart of the Voting Rights Act in June 2013, the mayor of this working-class industrial city set in motion a contentious change to the local election system that critics said was aimed at protecting white control of the City Council in the face of rapid growth in the citys Hispanic population.

title: Packers. Patriots. Steelers. Falcons. Who Has the Edge?
description: Road teams finally found the success they were missing in this seasons playoffs, with Green Bay and Pittsburgh advancing to the conference championships. Both will have to repeat that road success if either team wants to make it to Super Bowl LI in Houston, as the Packers will travel to Atlanta and the Steelers will be on their way to New England.

title: Lie to Me: Fiction in the Post-Truth Era
description: American novelists have long complained about the ability of real life to outstrip fiction. In his landmark 1961 essay Writing American Fiction, Philip Roth observed that actuality is continually outdoing our talents, and the culture tosses up figures almost daily that are the envy of any novelist. The figure Roth cites is Charles Van Doren, of quiz-show scandal fame; but place Mr. Van Doren next to Donald J. Trump, and you can measure the change in the nature of credibility over the past half-century.

title: As Australian Open Begins, Match Fixing Still Casts a Shadow
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  A year ago, opening day at the Australian Open was overshadowed by the publication of a report that raised concerns about potentially widespread match fixing in tennis.

title: Bill Maher Isnt High on Trump: The State of Free Speech in a New Era
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif.  It was Nov. 12, and Bill Maher was about to begin his comedy act at the City National Civic in San Jose when he did something he hadnt done in many years. He brought a drink with him to the stage; a standup roadie (tequila).

title: Prada: Mens Collection
description: Miuccia Prada shows her mens collection for fall 2017.

title: Trump, Twitter and the Art of His Deal
description: A few weeks after the election of Donald J. Trump, pundits with their eyes glued to Twitter believed theyd finally deciphered the master plan behind the president-elects tweeting. Every time he detonated a culture-war bomb on Twitter, they suspected, it was a sly bid to divert the public eye from more serious news about his impending administration.

title: Estate of Amber Lightfoot Walker Gifts $15.5 Million to Support Literature
description: Cultural institutions including Lincoln Center Theater, the Morgan Library & Museum and the 92nd Street Y have received multimillion dollar donations from the estate of Amber Lightfoot Walker, who died in 2014.

title: Tax Refund Loans Are Revamped and Resurrected
description: Fast, free money. Thats what H&R Block, the nations largest tax-preparation chain, is advertising on giant banners outside its storefronts and in TV commercials featuring Jon Hamm of Mad Men: You could get a refund advance of up to $1,250. It is the first time in six years that the company has offered to front customers some money from their anticipated refund.

title: Moncler Gamme Bleu: Mens Collection
description: The label shows their fall 2017 designs.

title: Conservationist Bud Lilly, a Trouts Best Friend, Dies at 91
description: Bud Lilly, a fly fisherman and conservationist whose fervent advocacy of catch and release inspired people to call him a trouts best friend, died on Jan. 4 in Bozeman, Mont. He was 91.

title: Trump Team Considers Moving Press Corps, Alarming Reporters
description: In the 1890s, journalists covering the president were forced to stand vigil outside the White House fence, querying visitors for scraps of information and appealing for audiences with presidential aides.

title: For Zegna, a Debut Amid Weighty Monuments
description: MILAN  A certain amount of anticipation had built up among the spectators invited to experience Alessandro Sartoris debut as the artistic director at Ermenegildo Zegna on a cold Friday, which happened to fall  luckily or unluckily  on the 13th.

title: Hot on the Trail of La La Land, Here Come More Movie Musicals
description: LOS ANGELES  Dead. Embalmed. Buried. A year ago, that is what most movie studios would have said about live-action musicals, pointing to a long line of box office calamities: Rock of Ages, Burlesque, Jersey Boys, Across the Universe, Nine.

title: Longing for the Spirit of 86 at the Emporio Armani Show
description: MILAN  A photocopied image from a catalogue sitting on the desk in front of me shows a handsome young lug in a cashmere Giorgio Armani hoodie. His arms are akimbo. His fists rest lightly on hips clad in neatly tailored trousers with triple inverted pleats. The woolen duster with raglan shoulders hes wearing looks slouchy and both retro and fully of the moment.

title: Dsquared2: Mens Collection
description: The latest mens designs from the label.

title: Neil Barretts Gender-Blur Army
description: MILAN  Something akin to retinal afterimage is the product of the best shows, those that memory retains once a presentation has ended. The son and grandson of tailors, Neil Barrett, the Milan-based English designer, habitually restricts his work to a narrow range of shapes, holds to a near-monochrome palette and builds silhouettes so tidily militaristic in precision that their image tends to linger after the lights have gone down.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Jan. 16
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday. Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills has been rescheduled for Tuesday in observance of Martin Luther Kings Birthday.

title: Completely
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Have you ever started solving a crossword puzzle and felt like you could predict the outcome? As you solve more crosswords, being able to predict a theme becomes more likely. Its just not that often that you predict that a given puzzle might blow The New York Timess standards out of the water. That was my experience today, but that experience probably says more about my own state of mind than the theme.

title: In Pakistan, Justice for the Killers Among Us
description: KARACHI, Pakistan  The army chief of Pakistan recently confirmed the death sentence of Saad Aziz, a business-school graduate and restaurant manager who was convicted of killing my friend Sabeen Mahmud. Sabeen, who was 40 then, ran The Second Floor in Karachi, a cafe where many writers and artists, including me, got their first break. It was also a hub for activists advocating controversial, often lost, causes. She was shot dead on April 24, 2015, minutes after a talk she had organized about the disappearance of Baloch activists, allegedly at the hand of Pakistans military intelligence agencies.

title: It Can Power a Small Nation. But This Wind Farm in China Is Mostly Idle.
description: JIUQUAN, China  On the edge of the Gobi Desert, the Jiuquan Wind Power Base stands as a symbol of Chinas quest to dominate the worlds renewable energy market. With more than 7,000 turbines arranged in rows that stretch along the sandy horizon, it is one of the worlds largest wind farms, capable of generating enough electricity to power a small country.

title: Davos to Commence as Investment Bank Earnings Are Released
description: Heres a look at whats coming up this week.

title: Heng on Trumps Challenge With China
description: Chinas decision to send an aircraft carrier through the waterway that separates it from Taiwan reflects an early foreign policy challenge for Donald Trump.

title: Andrew Ladd, and the Islanders, Try to Find Their Footing
description: EAST MEADOW, N.Y.  Andrew Ladd joined the Islanders last summer with a seven-year contract worth $38.5 million and hefty expectations that he would help the franchise improve on last seasons 100-point finish and second-round playoff appearance.

title: Kompromat and the Danger of Doubt and Confusion in a Democracy
description: WASHINGTON  Since the emergence of an unverified dossier with salacious claims about President-elect Donald J. Trump, Americans have debated the ramifications of the arrival of kompromat as a feature of American politics.

title: Rolling the Dice When a Guy Yells, Hey, Lady
description: Dear Diary:

title: Keeping Alive a Haven for Yiddish Culture in Modern Romania
description: BUCHAREST, Romania  Just a few minutes on foot from the bustle of downtown Bucharest, the State Jewish Theater, down a small side street in the Romanian capital, cuts a forlorn figure.

title: Celebrity Deaths of 2016
description: The year felt like a particularly bad one for celebrity deaths. But was it? We look back at some of obituaries that appeared on The Timess front page.

title: 2016 Was a Bad Year for Celebrity Deaths, by These Measures
description: 2016 was a particularly bad year for celebrity deaths, judging by the many mourners on social media platforms like Twitter and Facebook. But verifying that the year was unusually lethal for stars is tricky.

title: With Guilty Plea, Takata Clears Way for a Likely Global Rescue
description: TOKYO  With a $1 billion fine and a criminal guilty plea, Takata, the Japanese auto parts maker, took a major step on Friday toward putting the scandal over its deadly airbags behind it.

title: Restoring an Atmosphere, if Not Yet an Aura, in Manchester
description: MANCHESTER, England  In the last five minutes of a nerve-shredding 1-1 draw on Sunday, as his team swarmed forward and Liverpool seemed to tilt and teeter, Manchester United Manager Jos Mourinho got what he wanted.

title: No Corrections: January 16, 2017
description: No corrections appeared in print.

title: Jimmy Snuka, Ex-Pro Wrestler Known as Superfly, Dies at 73
description: Jimmy Snuka, a former professional wrestler known for his acrobatic moves in the ring and for a late-in-life murder charge that was thrown out after he was declared mentally unfit, died on Sunday in Florida. He was 73.

title: Cavaliers-Warriors Rematch Carries Meaning for Past and Future
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  No team is immune from the rigors of the N.B.A. schedule, not even royalty like the defending champion Cleveland Cavaliers.

title: Carmelo Anthony Speaks About His Future After Knicks Roll Over
description: The Knicks steady descent into chaos continued Sunday afternoon in Toronto, where forward Carmelo Anthony punctuated the teams blowout loss to the Raptors by lashing out at the teams management.

title: Corporations Open the Cash Spigot for Trumps Inauguration
description: WASHINGTON  When Donald J. Trump strides onto the inaugural ballroom floor this week amid the sprawling celebration of his swearing-in, he will have corporate America and many of its titans to thank for the rapturous greeting.

title: A Marni Rave, a Ferragamo Reboot
description: MILAN, Italy  Mens wear week in Milan doesnt look much like it used to. Many of the citys big names (Gucci, Bottega Veneta and Jil Sander among them) are sitting the season out. Some are lumping their mens shows in with their womens; others, like Jil Sander, are simply staying quietly out of the spotlight. And new designers have been installed in familiar houses: At Zegna, at Marni and at Salvatore Ferragamo.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: The two-state solution, which the international community has agreed on for many years, appears threatened.

title: Packers Thwart Cowboys as Time Expires to Make N.F.C. Title Game
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  There were 12 seconds remaining in a tied playoff game Sunday when Green Bay quarterback Aaron Rodgers began sprinting to his left, the football in his hands, as it so often seems to be at the end of taut, important games.

title: In Trumps Feud With John Lewis, Blacks Perceive a Callous Rival
description: Days before his inauguration, President-elect Donald J. Trump is engaged in a high-profile feud with some of the countrys most prominent African-American leaders, setting off anger in a constituency already wary of him after a contentious presidential campaign.

title: Funding Disparities Abound in New Yorks Senior Centers, Report Finds
description: Senior centers across New York City receive varying levels of funding from the city, and the disparities are glaring: A center in Lower Manhattan gets just $3.54 to provide a meal to an elderly client, while a center in Brooklyn gets $18.36.

title: Homeland Season 6, Episode 1: Carries a Civilian  and a Brooklynite
description: Could the first episode of this new season of Homeland be any more relentlessly grim?

title: Obama Legacy of Freeing Prisoners May Come Under Trump Siege
description: WASHINGTON  More than any administration in recent history, the Obama White House has focused on a law enforcement mission that might seem antithetical to hard-nosed prosecutors: getting criminal offenders out of jail early and trying to give them the skills to stay out.

title: Workers Say Andrew Puzder Is Not the One to Protect Them, but Hes Been Chosen To
description: At first, Andrew F. Puzders California story sounds like one of the states sunny dreams come true: Midwestern lawyer stumbles into burger business, nurses storied chain back to health, wins industry plaudits and record profits.

title: Trump Criticizes NATO and Hopes for Good Deals With Russia
description: WASHINGTON  In comments that are likely to create fresh tensions with the United States closest European allies, President-elect Donald J. Trump described NATO as obsolete in an interview published on Sunday and said other European nations would probably follow Britains lead by leaving the European Union.

title: Review: The Beauty Queen of Leenane: Oh Gosh, Ive Turned Into My Mother
description: The world has opened up for the poisonously insular mother and daughter of Martin McDonaghs The Beauty Queen of Leenane, which has been given an expansive revival at the Brooklyn Academy of Music. For starters, the rural Irish digs shared by Mag and Maureen Folan, one of the nastiest family units ever to grace (or disgrace) a stage, are larger than when this satanically funny pair first arrived in New York nearly two decades ago.

title: The Affair Season 3, Episode 8: People See What They Want to See
description: The Affair got back to Montauk with an Alison-and-Cole episode Sunday night, after two bleak weeks with Helen and Noah. But things werent very sunny on the South Fork. Cole worked out his feelings about his ex-wife over a couple of testy days, at the end of which Alison framed the question for him  he could leave his current wife, Luisa, to return to Alison and be a happy jerk, or he could stay with Luisa, preserve his self-image as a good guy and be a miserable hero. He decided to stay, and his episode-ending expression as he and Luisa hugged did look pretty miserable.

title: Trump Promises Insurance for Everybody as Health Law Replacement
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trump said this weekend that he was nearly ready to unveil a plan to replace President Obamas Affordable Care Act with insurance for everybody.

title: Samsung Heir Faces Arrest on Charges of Bribing South Koreas President
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The sprawling investigation into President Park Geun-hye of South Korea took a dramatic turn on Monday with word that prosecutors were seeking the arrest of the de facto head of Samsung, one of the worlds largest conglomerates, on charges that he bribed the president and her secretive confidante.

title: Shelby Rogers Ousts Fourth Seed Simona Halep at Australian Open
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Shelby Rogers, who made one of last seasons most surprising surges, picked up where she left off by delivering the first major upset of the Australian Open on Monday.

title: Justin Thomas, Golf Prodigy, Collects Wins and Waits for His Chance to Catch Up
description: HONOLULU  Inside the golf shop at Harmony Landing Country Club in Goshen, Ky., there are 129 golf balls on a rack. Each ball represents one of Justin Thomass wins, starting in elementary school. In a nearby box, there are balls from his holes-in-one.

title: Where Civil Rights Meet the Civil War
description: Lexington, Va., has a rich Confederate history. This year, residents marched in the city's first Martin Luther King Jr. parade. Down the road, others saluted the Confederacy.

title: A New Martin Luther King Jr. Parade Divides a Virginia Town
description: LEXINGTON, Va.  For years, the weekend leading up to the observance of the Martin Luther King Jr. holiday has been overshadowed here by a celebration and a parade honoring two Confederate generals whose birthdays fall within days of the civil rights icons: Robert E. Lee and Stonewall Jackson.

title: Li Ka-shing Sweetens Deal for Australian Energy Company
description: HONG KONG  Hong Kongs richest man has taken a step closer to winning control of a big Australian energy company, as he seeks to overcome Australias occasional wariness toward foreign investors from China.

title: Steelers Hold On Against Chiefs to Reach A.F.C. Championship
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  The playoffs within the A.F.C. playoffs concluded Sunday night at Arrowhead Stadium, and the winners afterward received not a glistening trophy or pristine new caps to wear but a more urgent, less tangible distinction. They earned a coveted title, the Team Most Equipped to Face the New England Patriots, and a chance to assert their legitimacy once more.

title: With the Tennis Season Beginning, a Wish List for 2017
description: Tennis got more than its share of undesirable events in 2016: Roger Federers first surgery, Maria Sharapovas  suspension for a doping violation, the knife attack on Petra Kvitova that left the future of her career in doubt.

title: Whats on TV Monday: 13th and Civil Rights Documentaries
description: In honor of Martin Luther Kings Birthday, stream 13th, Ava DuVernays take on what she sees as a different form of slavery in the United States: the mass incarceration of African-American men. Or take your pick of civil rights documentaries on Turner Classic Movies.

title: Turkish Cargo Plane Crashes Into Village in Kyrgyzstan, Killing Dozens
description: HONG KONG  A Turkish cargo plane approaching the airport in Kyrgyzstans capital crashed early Monday, killing at least 37 people, most of them on the ground, according to the Kyrgyz government.

title: Review: Art and Saint Joan
description: LONDON  Who knew Art could be so angry?

title: Johns Gospel of Trumps Illegitimacy
description: On Friday, the Georgia congressman, civil rights icon and Donald Trump inauguration-boycotter John Lewis told NBCs Chuck Todd something that I believe millions of Americans are thinking.

title: The Rural-Urban Divide in America
description: To the Editor:

title: Issues Surrounding Betsy DeVos, the Education Nominee
description: To the Editor:

title: The Assault on Health and Safety Begins
description: Donald Trump has been consistent on one thing. He wants to weaken or end regulations on businesses and industries. As if on cue, House Republicans and a handful of Democrats recently passed three bills that would radically deregulate corporate America.

title: With All Due Disrespect
description: As a young man, Congressman John Lewis, who represents most of Atlanta, literally put his life on the line in pursuit of justice. As a key civil rights leader, he endured multiple beatings. Most famously, he led the demonstration that came to be known as Bloody Sunday, suffering a fractured skull at the hands of state troopers. Public outrage over that days violence helped lead to the enactment of the Voting Rights Act.

title: Finding Myself Through My College Major
description: HOLLAND, Mich.  At some point during my freshman year in college, I went to a church in town with a friend. When the service was over, I stood up and an elderly man who sat in the pew in front of me shook my hand. Im not sure Id even gotten his name before he fired off, So I suppose youre from one of those Oriental nations, right?

title: Ask Alexa? No, Hear This Alexa
description: It started around the holidays. My eyes began to dart involuntarily to call-outs of my name on social media.

title: Which Martin Luther King Are We Celebrating Today?
description: Newburyport, Mass.  Every year on the third Monday of January, Americans of all races, backgrounds and ideologies celebrate the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. He is rightly lionized and sanctified by whites as well as blacks, by Republicans as well as Democrats.

title: Young Victims of the Opioid Epidemic
description: Opioid overdoses have claimed more than 300,000 lives in the last 15 years, including some 33,000 in 2015 alone. But those numbers do not tell the full horror of this epidemic, which has devastated the lives of countless children whose parents have succumbed to addiction to prescription painkillers and other opiates. In one terrible case last month, a Pennsylvania couple died of apparent overdoses, and their baby perished from starvation a few days later.

title: The Stories We Tell Ourselves
description: Heres a story:

title: The Sun Finally Sets on Sugar Cane in Hawaii
description: Hawaiis last working sugar mill, in Puunene, Maui, produced its last harvest last month. The last truck, piled high with newly cut cane stalks, blew its horn as it circled the mill yard. People cheered and held high their phones; a priest led a prayer. The cane was later put on a ship for processing in California, and 375 employees of the Hawaiian Commercial & Sugar Company became the last of the last to be laid off.

title: Obamas Secret to Surviving the White House Years: Books
description: Not since Lincoln has there been a president as fundamentally shaped  in his life, convictions and outlook on the world  by reading and writing as Barack Obama.

title: Transcript: President Obama on What Books Mean to Him
description: Michiko Kakutani, the chief book critic for The New York Times, interviewed President Obama about literature on Friday at the White House. Here are excerpts from the conversation, which have been edited and condensed.

title: Luxottica, Owner of Ray-Ban, in $49 Billion Merger With Essilor
description: LONDON  Essilor of France said on Monday that it would merge with the Luxottica Group of Italy, owner of the Ray-Ban and Oakley brands, in a $49 billion deal that would create a giant in the eyewear industry.

title: Morning Agenda: Davos Man vs. Trump, Samsung Leader Faces Arrest, Tax Time
description: Its that time of year again: The worlds most expensive networking event starts at the snowy resort of Davos in Switzerland on Tuesday.

title: T City Guides: Marrakesh
description: Though Marrakesh is steeped in Moroccan history and culture, its creative crowd  including the five people below  embraces modernity. Contemporary art galleries reside among 16th-century palaces, and avant-garde concept stores have become as integral to the shopping landscape as the souks of the medina. To fully appreciate Marrakesh today, its all about finding the right balance between the old and new.

title: Chinas Poplar Trees: A Spring Nuisance That Snows White Fluff
description: When spring arrives in China, few things are as loathed as the fuzzy, flamboyant poplar trees.

title: Where the Clothes Do Most of the Work
description: I do not think that I was prepared for the mannequins.

title: President Rodrigo Duterte of Philippines Criticized Over Martial Law Warning
description: MANILA  Rights advocates and survivors of the dictatorship of Ferdinand E. Marcos, the former Philippine leader, criticized President Rodrigo Duterte on Monday for saying that he could impose martial law to curb what he has called a runaway drug problem.

title: Worlds 8 Richest Have as Much Wealth as Bottom Half, Oxfam Says
description: How concentrated has wealth become in the globalized modern world? Heres one answer: Just eight of the richest people on earth own as much combined wealth as half the human race.

title: The Banned Books Your Child Should Read
description: More than 40 years ago, my seventh grade English teacher began the year by telling us that we were definitely not allowed to read The Catcher in the Rye because we werent ready for it. So naturally we all went out and read it immediately.

title: Physician Aid in Dying Gains Acceptance in the U.S.
description: Judith Katherine Dunning had been waiting anxiously for California to adopt legislation that would make it legal for her to end her life.

title: The Real Manakin Challenge
description: Male manakins leap, flip and snap their wings to attract females. With a bit of testosterone the females perform some of the same difficult acrobatics.

title: A Manakin Challenge for Researchers
description: Lets get the temptation to make bad jokes out of the way first. This story is about manakins, not mannequins. It is about mating acrobatics by Panamanian birds, not the mannequin challenge.

title: In Watches: New Faces in Geneva
description: The 27th edition of the Salon International de la Haute Horlogerie (SIHH) opened Monday, with more brands exhibiting this year and the events first public day scheduled Friday. Here are some highlights.

title: Vacheron Constantin Introduces Its Most Complicated Wristwatch
description: Vacheron Constantin has announced the Les Cabinotiers Celestia Astronomical Grand Complication 3600  with 23 complications, the most complicated wristwatch the company has ever made.

title: Cargo Plane Crashes in Kyrgyzstan
description: A Boeing 747 cargo jet owned by a Turkish airline and en route to Istanbul from Hong Kong crashed into a village near the capital, Bishkek, killing at least 30.

title: Why Medical Advice Seems to Change So Frequently
description: Medical scientists and academics must publish their research to advance. Medical organizations must release health recommendations to remain relevant. News organizations feel they must report on research and recommendations as they are released. But sometimes its hard to separate whats truly a medical certainty from what is merely solid scientific conjecture.

title: Mayor de Blasio Seeks Small Donations to Fill War Chest Amid Inquiries
description: With fewer than 10 months to Election Day, and no credible challenger having emerged, Mayor Bill de Blasios path to re-election in New York City would seem fairly assured, buoyed by the benefits of incumbency: name recognition and fund-raising strength.

title: What to Make of the Davos Class in the Trump Era
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  President-elect Donald Trump has never been invited here. Neither has Nigel Farage, the British politician who led the Brexit campaign.

title: Job Listings That Are Too Feminine for Men
description: Job postings for home health aides say applicants need to be sympathetic and caring, empathetic and focused on families. It turns out that doesnt lead very many men to apply.

title: Obama-Era Political Losses, the Real Story
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: Trump Attacks BMW and Mercedes, but Auto Industry Is a Complex Target
description: BEIJING  In his latest criticism of what he sees as unfair trade, Donald J. Trump has taken aim at German cars. Why, the president-elect asked a German newspaper, do so many well-heeled drivers in New York drive a Mercedes-Benz, while Germans buy so few Chevrolets?

title: The Lady and the Rohingya
description: YANGON, Myanmar  Just days before the November 2015 general election, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi was asked how she would remedy the long-running repression of the Rohingya, a Muslim minority, if her party came to power. She replied: Theres a Burmese saying: You have to make big problems small and small problems disappear.

title: North Africas Next War
description: TIFARITI, Western Sahara  Uninhabited and less than three miles long, the rocky, flat area known as Guerguerat falls under no formal government rule. It lies near North Africas Atlantic coast, some 40 miles north of Nouadhibou, a thriving Mauritanian port city. The main industry  if you can call it that  is smuggling. And it could be the place where Africas next war begins.

title: U.K. Police Look to Young Recruits to Help Shed an Image as Male, Pale and Stale
description: BURNLEY, England  Francesca Wheatley does not seem like a police officer, at least not to those around her.

title: Getting Older, Sleeping Less
description: Insomnia is like a thief in the night, robbing millions  especially those older than 60  of much-needed restorative sleep. As the king laments in Shakespeares Henry IV, Part 2: O sleep, O gentle sleep, Natures soft nurse, how have I frightened thee. That thou no more will weigh my eyelids down, And steep my senses in forgetfulness?

title: With Blacks Alarmed by His Tone, Trump Meets With Martin Luther King III
description: WASHINGTON  With tensions escalating between President-elect Donald J. Trump and prominent black leaders, Mr. Trump met privately on Monday with the eldest son of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. on the holiday devoted to the civil rights hero.

title: Celebration of Martin Luther King Jr. Still Faces Pushback
description: Today is Martin Luther Kings Birthday, the federal holiday that honors the assassinated civil rights leader.

title: Making Twitter Lists With Android
description: Q. Is there a way to group users into lists within the Twitter Android app or do you have to do it from the web? And how do you find the lists in the mobile version?

title: Packers Bury the Memories of Playoff Failures
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  Lets not do this again, Mason Crosby said to himself as he and the Green Bay Packers watched the Dallas Cowboys march back from an 18-point deficit in their N.F.C. playoff game on Sunday.

title: Officer Faces Possible Discipline in Fatal Shooting of Bronx Teenager
description: Nearly five years have passed since an 18-year-old unarmed black man was fatally shot by a white New York City police officer who barged into the bathroom of his home in the Bronx.

title: Born to Be an Ear Wiggler?
description: Q. Why can some people wiggle their ears, but not others?

title: Absolutely Every Bit of Our Galaxy
description: Astronomers have arrived at what they believe to be the most accurate measure yet of the mass of the Milky Way: about 4.8 x 1011 times the mass of the sun, or solar masses, to use a standard unit of mass in astronomy.

title: Political Crisis Engulfs Samsung, a Firm Tied to South Koreas Success
description: HONG KONG  Samsung, the giant maker of products as varied as cargo ships and smartphones, is one of the driving forces of the South Korean economy. Now, the fate of its leadership could be tied to the sprawling investigation of a corruption scandal involving the nations president.

title: The Cavs, the Warriors and the Five Best N.B.A. Games This Week
description: By weeks end, we will have reached the midpoint of the N.B.A. season.

title: Etro: Mens Collection
description: The label shows their fall 2017 designs.

title: Venus Smiled, With a Mysterious Wave Across Its Atmosphere
description: For a few days, Venus smiled  sideways.

title: Dangers Behind and Uncertainties Ahead, but Together at Last
description: It seemed like another normal day for Jos Rivera. His mother dropped him off at his school in San Salvador, hugging him tightly as she told him she would see him at the end of the day. But there was one detail that, even then at age 6, Jos thought was strange: She was crying.

title: 12 Recipes for Now
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: MSGM: Mens Collection
description: The latest mens designs from the label.

title: F.B.I. Arrests Wife of Killer in Orlando Mass Shooting
description: WASHINGTON  The F.B.I. arrested the wife of the man who carried out a deadly terrorist attack in Orlando, Fla., and charged her with obstructing the investigation of the mass shooting, law enforcement officials said on Monday.

title: In N.F.L. Playoffs, 4 Elite Quarterbacks Are Left Standing
description: Brady. Rodgers. Roethlisberger. Ryan.

title: Andy Murray, No. 1 and Newly Knighted, Still Has Room for More
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  So Ivan, are you calling Andy Sir?

title: Putting More Women on a Path to Political Power
description: BERLIN  About five decades since the surge in modern feminism, it is unlikely that most women  in the United States, at least  would have anticipated the current political climate in which gender equality remains almost as elusive as ever and long-ago-won rights are under siege.

title: 2 Years, 31 Dead Construction Workers. New York Can Do Better.
description: On Dec. 23, on the Upper East Side of New York City, yet another construction worker died. His name has not yet been released, but he was the 31st to die on the job in the city in the past two years. He was working on a nonunion work site, as were 28 of the 30 others. Fabian Para, who worked nearby, explained that he was on the third floor, and he was wearing a harness but wasnt hooked to a cable, and when he fell, he just went down.

title: 10 More Detainees Are Transferred From Guantnamo Prison
description: WASHINGTON  With days left in the Obama administration, the United States has sent 10 more lower-level detainees from the wartime prison at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, to Oman, and lawyers for two more who are on a list of those recommended for transfer are urgently asking a court to send them home as well.

title: After Plagiarism Reports, Monica Crowley Wont Take White House Job
description: Monica Crowley, who was selected just weeks ago to serve in a high-profile post on President-elect Donald J. Trumps National Security Council, has decided against taking the position after allegations that she plagiarized key passages in a 2012 book.

title: How the Response to Zika Failed Millions
description: Almost a year ago, the World Health Organization declared the Zika epidemic a global health emergency, calling for an epic campaign against a virus that few had ever heard of. As it spread to almost every country in the Western Hemisphere, scientists and health officials at every level of government swung into action, trying to understand how the infection caused birth defects and how it could be stopped.

title: The Stem-Cell Revolution Is Coming  Slowly
description: In 2001, President George W. Bush issued an executive order banning federal funding for new sources of stem cells developed from preimplantation human embryos. The action stalled research and discouraged scientists.

title: Antiaircraft Weapons Again Open Fire in Tehran
description: TEHRAN  Perplexed residents of Tehran focused their eyes  and smartphones  upward on Monday afternoon as antiaircraft weapons hidden on rooftops suddenly began blasting away at an unidentified flying object in the clear sky.

title: Cold War Jitters Resurface as U.S. Marines Arrive in Norway
description: For Norwegians, the sight of dozens of American Marines traipsing through the snow in military fatigues  the first time foreign forces have been posted to their countrys territory since World War II  may have brought a welcomed sense of security, but it also harked back to a dark era of the Cold War that many had hoped to forget.

title: Donald Trump, Samsung, World Economic Forum: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Fendi: Mens Collection
description: The labels mens collection.

title: Metal Detectorists Help Archaeologists Dig Up a Secret History
description: NEW LONDON, Conn.  Keith Wille was metal detecting in the woods of Connecticut a few years ago when he found a triangle of brass about two-and-a-half inches long with a small hole in the middle. He thought little of the find at first, and threw it in his scrap pile. Mr. Wille, 29, is a manager at a survival training company, but spends most of his spare time metal detecting.

title: The Weeknds Starboy and the La La Land Soundtrack Top the Chart
description: This week on the Billboard album chart, the Weeknd holds at No. 1, while the La La Land soundtrack shoots to No. 2 after the film won seven Golden Globe Awards.

title: U.S. Crackdown on Corporate Wrongdoers May Be Undone by National Borders
description: The outgoing leadership of the Justice Department is ending its tenure with a bang, trying to show that the policy focused on pursuing cases against individuals involved in corporate misconduct was more than mere rhetoric.

title: Lisa Kron Awarded Kleban Prize for Musical Theater
description: Lisa Kron and Daniel Zaitchik have been awarded the 2017 Kleban Prizes for writing in musical theater.

title: Rolls-Royce to Pay $817 Million to Resolve Bribery and Graft Inquiries
description: LONDON  Rolls-Royce, the maker of jet engines and other power systems, said on Monday that it had agreed to pay $817 million to resolve several long-running bribery and corruption inquiries.

title: Mens Fashion Shows: Prada, Marni, Ferragamo and More
description: A photo diary of the fall/winter 2017 collections that were presented in Milan last weekend.

title: 5 Killed at BPM Festival in Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY  Five people were killed early Monday at a crowded nightclub in the popular Caribbean tourist destination of Playa del Carmen, Mexico, when an armed man who had been denied entry opened fire inside the club, prompting a gun battle and a stampede, officials said.

title: Akhilesh Yadav, Indian Politician, Wins Right to Use Bicycle as Election Symbol
description: NEW DELHI  Indias election commission on Monday resolved a feud that had split one of the countrys most powerful political dynasties, by granting the politician Akhilesh Yadav his partys most recognizable asset: the image of a bicycle.

title: How to Plan a Volunteering Vacation
description: A volunteering vacation can be a meaningful way to spend your time off, said Courtney Regan, the founder of the San Francisco travel company Courtney Regan Travel and an expert on what is known as voluntourism. But she added that there are several factors to consider to make the trip fulfilling and ensure that your efforts are productive both for you and the cause youre supporting.

title: Eight Crossings and 192 Atoms Long: the Tightest Knot Ever Tied
description: British scientists have tied the tightest knot ever tied and, as unlikely as it may seem, this is important.

title: In Home of Hip-Hop, a Concert Hall to Honor Its Musical History
description: The South Bronx may be known as the birthplace of hip-hop, but it was a springboard for musical talent long before that occurred.

title: Knicks Juggle Starting Lineup, but the Result Is Familiar
description: As the final seconds of another loss wound down at Madison Square Garden on Monday afternoon, the Knicks put up one shot after another  three in all, any one of which could have given them a victory.

title: As Inauguration Nears, Trump Keeps World Leaders on Edge
description: He called NATO obsolete. He said Germanys acceptance of refugees is utterly catastrophic. The decades-old One China policy embraced by the United States? Thats up for discussion. Just days before Donald J. Trumps inauguration, world leaders on three continents are on edge after comments the president-elect made in an interview on Friday with The Wall Street Journal and in a weekend interview with two European newspapers, Bild and The Times of London.

title: For Trump, Three Decades of Chasing Deals in Russia
description: It was 2005, and Felix Sater, a Russian immigrant, was back in Moscow pursuing an ambitious plan to build a Trump tower on the site of an old pencil factory along the Moscow River that would offer hotel rooms, condominiums and commercial office space.

title: Class Takes Satirical Aim at Brooklyn Grade-School Parents
description: We are in Brooklyn or at least a certain echelon of it, which means a crisis has arisen over what constitutes an appropriate snack for a third grader. One mom has brought Chips Ahoy! cookies laced with Reeses Pieces into the home of Karen Kipple, another mom.

title: Voice of Politics in Nevada Media Starts a News Website
description: In the months after Sheldon Adelson, a casino magnate and prominent Republican donor, purchased The Las Vegas Review-Journal in late 2015, one local journalist was particularly relentless in criticizing the new ownership.

title: Irma Booms Library, Where Pure Experimentalism Is on the Shelf
description: AMSTERDAM Irma Boompays careful attention to word choice. The Dutch designer,one of the worldspre-eminent bookmakers,is loath to say client and refers to her projects as commissions. She also doesnt call herself an artist.

title: As Trump Era Arrives, a Sense of Uncertainty Grips the World
description: LONDON  The Germans are angry. The Chinese are downright furious. Leaders of NATO are nervous, while their counterparts at the European Union are alarmed.

title: Suspect in Istanbul Rampage on New Years Is Captured, Turkey Says
description: The police in Turkey have arrested the man accused of carrying out a deadly attack on an Istanbul nightclub early on New Years Day, killing 39 people, including a police officer and 25 foreigners, according to the semiofficial Anadolu news agency as well as Turkish news reports.

title: Northern Ireland, Forced by Sinn Fein, Sets Early Election in Shadow of Brexit
description: DUBLIN  Voters in Northern Ireland will go to the polls on March 2 in a snap election that was forced by the main Catholic party, Sinn Fein, after the collapse of a regional government in which Catholics and Protestants shared power.

title: Transition Television, From PBS and CNN
description: This is just a guess, but the pre-inaugural programming that is all over television at the moment feels as if it might go largely unwatched. The offerings are generally some combination of Obama-years retrospective and how-we-got-to-this-point analysis. Do admirers of President Obama really want to revisit his slow slide from 2008 triumph to 2017 vilification? Do fans of the president-elect, Donald J. Trump, want to do anything other than say, Dont let the door hit you on the way out and then plunge into their new opportunity?

title: Review: Made in China, With Romance, Polemics and Puppets
description: Puppets are hardly a novelty on New York stages, but Ill bet youve never seen one representing a talking, singing toilet plunger, have you?

title: Andrew Normans Play, a Symphony That Levels Up
description: CINCINNATI  I wish you all could see Play performed live.

title: Muslim Comics in a Mordant Act of Resistance
description: Look at how many brown people are here! Dean Obeidallah said to cheers after taking the stage Sunday at the Comic Strip Live, a comedy club on the Upper East Side of Manhattan.

title: A Rare Corner of Finance Where Women Dominate
description: Once a year, a small group of executives who control trillions of dollars in American companies meet for lunch in Manhattan. Among the things they discuss: pushing for greater say in how companies are run.

title: Fight for Art: Jeremy Scott of Moschino Responds to Donald Trump
description: MILAN  Jeremy Scott has been the designer of Moschino since the waning days of 2013, but he remains very much an American in Milan. He lives in a hotel within walking distance of Moschinos offices on Via San Gregorio; asked to name a favorite Milan restaurant, he couldnt. (He often dines at the Moschino cafeteria, which prepares him special vegetarian meals.)

title: Review: [Porto] Features a Bar Regular Looking for Love
description: [Porto], which was presented at the Bushwick Starr as part of the 2017 Exponential Festival,  reopens at the WP Theater (in a coproduction with the Bushwick Starr and New Georges), 2162 Broadway, Manhattan; 866-811-4111. Here is the original review  which appeared in The New York Times on Jan. 16, 2017.

title: Fear Spurs Support for Health Law as Republicans Work to Repeal It
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trump and congressional Republicans appear to have accomplished a feat that President Obama, with all the power at his disposal, could not in the past seven years: They have galvanized outspoken support for the Affordable Care Act.

title: Springsteen Tribute Band Pulls Out of New Jersey Inauguration Gala
description: There will have to be a B-Street shuffle at an unofficial inaugural ball in Washington. A Bruce Springsteen tribute band is withdrawing from headlining the Garden State Inaugural Gala after receiving thousands of angry emails from Springsteen fans.

title: Interior Nominee Promotes Navy SEAL Career, While Playing Down Bad Judgment
description: In his successful runs for state senator in Montana and then for Congress, Representative Ryan Zinke has promoted his 23-year career in the Navy SEALs as one of his main credentials, going so far as to put the SEALs Trident symbol on his campaign bus.

title: Kevin Starr, Prolific Chronicler of Californias History, Dies at 76
description: Kevin Starr, whose eight-volume history of California, collectively known as Americans and the California Dream, traced the promise and the perils of his native state with a novelists sense of narrative and character and a filmmakers eye for colorful detail, died on Saturday in San Francisco. He was 76.

title: What the U.S. Gets for Defending Its Allies and Interests Abroad
description: President-elect Donald J. Trump will enter office inheriting a vast system of global alliances and commitments. While he has characterized them as a series of separate deals, they make more sense if viewed together and as investments in a global order that serves American interests in several key ways.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Its hard to convince shareholders and partners they are a hip Silicon Valley-style company when these charges show them to be a company run like a feudal dynasty.

title: Dick Gautier, Who Played a Rock Star in Bye Bye Birdie, Is Dead
description: Dick Gautier, a comic actor best known for his Tony-nominated performance as a vain rock n roll star in the Broadway musical Bye Bye Birdie and his recurring role as a robot with a heart on the television show Get Smart, died on Friday in Arcadia, Calif. He was 85.

title: Hans Berliner, Master Chess Player and Programmer, Dies at 87
description: Hans Berliner, a former world champion of correspondence chess who won one of the greatest games ever played on his way to the title, and who later helped develop game-playing computers, died on Friday in Riviera Beach, Fla. He was 87.

title: Trump Health Secretary Picks Longtime Foes: Big Government and Insurance Companies
description: ROSWELL, Ga.  It was 1 in the morning, and the orthopedic surgeon on call was preparing to operate on a woman whose foot had been shattered in a car wreck, after hours of tending to other patients. The womans husband, Jeff Anderson, asked him, Are you too tired to do this?

title: Getting a Compliment From One Who Knows
description: Dear Diary:

title: Cuomo Nominates Rowan Wilson to New Yorks Highest Court
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has chosen Rowan D. Wilson, a partner in a prominent Manhattan law firm, to be a judge on New York States highest court, the governors office announced on Monday.

title: Mr. Obama, Pick Up Your Pardon Pen

description: When Donald J. Trump announced he was running for president in a 2015 speech calling Mexican immigrants criminals and rapists, Rachel McCormick declared to her husband, Irvi Cruz, If he wins, were leaving.

title: Egyptian Court Blocks Plan to Transfer Two Islands to Saudi Arabia
description: CAIRO  An Egyptian court on Monday upheld a ruling that said the government cannot transfer control of two key Red Sea islands to its main financial backer, Saudi Arabia, deepening a rift between the two Middle Eastern countries.

description: Eugene A. Cernan, the commander of the Apollo 17 lunar-landing mission in 1972 and the last human to walk on the moon, died on Monday in Houston. He was 82.

description: A fitness report, signed by retired Vice Adm. Albert M. Calland III, who was the commander of the Naval Special Warfare Development Group, better known as SEAL Team 6, cited Mr. Zinke's "lapses in judgement" for his declining performance. Such language in these reports regularly prevents servicemen and women from rising to the highest officer ranks.

description: A hip-hop podcast host who feuded for years with the Brooklyn rapper Troy Ave was arrested on Monday on a federal weapons possession charge in connection with a shooting last year in which the rappers bodyguard was killed.

title: Hello, Fans. Were the New Yankees. Sandwich?
description: Gary Sanchez, the young catcher and face of the rebuilding Yankees, stood behind a counter Monday afternoon and prepared two sandwiches for starry-eyed customers at the Bullpen Deli Twin Donut on 161st Street in the Bronx. The current teams greatest slugger somehow cobbled together a turkey, lettuce and tomato concoction on a roll, with mayo. Then he created a simpler ham and cheese.

title: Desired as Cornerstone, an Injured Jeremy Lin Is Watching the Nets Crumble
description: Entering this season, the Nets fifth in Brooklyn, the game the Nets played Sunday against the Houston Rockets could have been viewed as an important milepost on the schedule.

title: President Obama, a White Sox Fan, Welcomes the Cubs to the White House
description: WASHINGTON  The team that wins the World Series typically visits the White House during the subsequent baseball season. But President Obama wanted none of that tradition. With his presidency down to its final week, and the start of the 2017 season still more than two months away, Mr. Obama arranged for the Chicago Cubs to celebrate on Monday.

title: As Support for E.U. Flags Elsewhere, Bulgaria Sees Its Benefits
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria  With Bulgaria in the grips of a bank run in the summer of 2014, Lyubomir Vassilev was panicking.

description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Casey Dellacqua, a former top-10 player and major finalist in womens doubles and a Grand Slam champion in mixed doubles, is returning to tennis this week at the Australian Open after nine months away because of a concussion.

description: OTTAWA  Canadas federal conflict-of-interest and ethics office confirmed on Monday that it is investigating the propriety of Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and his familys spending part of the Christmas holidays as guests of the Aga Khan, the billionaire philanthropist and spiritual leader of Ismaili Muslims, on a private island in the Bahamas.

title: For Ben Franklins Birthday, His First Piece of Printing Reappears

title: Beloved Actress
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Crossword puzzles arent well known for evoking emotions. You dont think about filling in empty squares and tearing up as you solve, but Ill freely admit that I went a bit mushy when I saw where todays theme was headed.

title: Donald Trumps Childhood Home Goes to Auction
description: The butter-colored home with a beamed, Tudor-style roof sits on Wareham Place in the Jamaica Estates neighborhood of Queens. It is a comfortable five-bedroom house that seems to have little more than a pleasant sun room and a cozy fireplace to distinguish it.

title: Norwegian Expands in the Trans-Atlantic Market
description: Just three and a half years ago, Norwegian was an upstart discount carrier entering the long-haul market. Now it is the 10th-largest trans-Atlantic airline by percentage of seats offered. The growth of Norwegian is a sign of the competitive threat on trans-Atlantic routes faced by legacy carriers like British Airways, Delta and American.

description: President-elect Donald J. Trumps childhood home in Queens is up for auction. Take a tour of the home that he lived in until age 4.

title: Serena Williams Downs Belinda Bencic in First Round of Australian Open
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  The danger can come from anywhere at this stage, as Serena Williams proved two weeks ago with an early loss in Auckland, New Zealand, after making 88 unforced errors in the wind against the young American Madison Brengle.

description: A young New Yorkers ambitions go awry when life happens in Maggies Plan, starring Greta Gerwig. Throwing Shade, the popular current-events podcast, comes to television. And Sundance Now offers a film primer in preparation for the Trump presidency.

description: Ted Ligety, a two-time Olympic skiing gold medalist and a five-time world champion, announced Monday that he planned to have a back operation that would end his World Cup racing this winter and could cloud his prospects for the Winter Olympics next year in Pyeongchang, South Korea.

description: HONG KONG  Almost three years after Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 disappeared with 239 people on board, officials said on Tuesday that they had called off the underwater search for the plane, ensuring that one of the great aviation mysteries will remain unsolved for the foreseeable future.

If it didnt have a crunch to it  say, cookies, crackers or extra crispy fries  he couldnt even put it near his lips. But Ms. Mackson, of Shrewsbury, Mass., figured her son would eventually grow out of his fussiness.

title: The Most Successful Democrat Since F.D.R.
description: When Barack Obama ran for president in 2008, he understood, without quite saying it, that there had been no highly successful Democratic president in decades.

title: What Thomas Merton and Muhammad Ali Had in Common
description: On an afternoon in 1958, near the shopping district at Walnut and Fourth Streets in Louisville, Ky., Thomas Merton was moving about inconspicuously gathering supplies for the Abbey at Gethsemani. The monastery, established in 1848 by the Order of Trappist Cistercians, is in Nelson County, south of Louisville near Bardstown. It is where Merton lived as a Trappist monk beginning in 1941.

title: Scientists to Government: Make It Easier to Study Marijuana
description: Even as more and more states allow their residents to use marijuana, the federal government is continuing to obstruct scientists from studying whether the drug is good or bad for peoples health.

description: King David was most compelling when he danced. Overcome by gratitude to God, he stripped down to his linens and whirled about before the ark of the covenant  his love and joy spilling beyond the boundaries of normal decorum.

title: The G.O.P.s Health Care Death Spiral
description: Last week, President-elect Donald J. Trump called Obamacare a complete and total disaster, and pushed for a swift repeal of the Affordable Care Act and a replacement within weeks. But at the moment, there is no workable replacement. So what happens to the individual insurance market  whose problems did not start with the Affordable Care Act and will not be easily solved  when it is destabilized so dramatically?

title: House Arms Itself for Witch Hunts
description: Early this month, House Republicans ditched a plan to gut an independent congressional ethics agency after their attempt set off a burst of outrage. Unfortunately, other procedural rule changes intended to reduce transparency and accountability in the House, introduced along with the ethics plan, were approved without much notice.

title: U.S. Ambassadors in Asia Make Final Plea for Dead Trans-Pacific Trade Pact
description: When hope of enacting the ambitious Trans-Pacific Partnership trade pact ended in November, Max Baucus, the United States ambassador to China, was among the officials who had to grapple with disappointment.

description: The clout of the Davos Man may be in question with the victories of Donald J. Trump and the Brexit campaign, but the worlds leaders and thinkers are rolling into the snowy resort of Davos, Switzerland, all the same.

title: Growing Old
description: This illustration above comes from a Sunday Review article that explained the implications of a recent study on superagers and what makes them tick.

title: From Mystery to History: Pennsylvanias Bygone Lumber Industry
description: Though Harry Littell was teaching digital photography to Lois Barden, she came to class one day in 2004 with a question about a much older process. She had with her a box of 8-by-10 glass plate negatives that she had found 30 years earlier in a shed belonging to her husbands grandmother near Rochester, N.Y. She asked her teacher what he thought. When he started scanning the plates, Mr. Littell was amazed. There were images of logging camps, railroads, studio portraits, children and outdoor scenes.

title: Questions for: In Trumps Feud With John Lewis, Blacks Perceive a Callous Rival
description: Article: In Trumps Feud With John Lewis, Blacks Perceive a Callous Rival

title: British American Tobacco to Take Over Reynolds American in $49 Billion Deal
description: LONDON  British American Tobacco said on Tuesday that its sweetened offer to buy the stake in Reynolds American that it did not already own had been accepted, a $49 billion deal that would create a tobacco giant with a significant presence around the world.

title: Reading the Classic Novel That Predicted Trump
description: The anxiety began well before the Cleveland convention, where the candidate of the Forgotten Men, the one who declared Americans the greatest Race on the face of this old Earth, seemed likely to clinch his partys presidential nomination. Doremus Jessup, the protagonist of Sinclair Lewiss 1935 novel It Cant Happen Here, sees something dark and terrible brewing in American politics  the potential for a real fascist dictatorship led by the up-and-coming populist candidate Berzelius Windrip. Friends scoff at this extravagant concern. That couldnt happen here in America, not possibly! they assure him. But Jessup, a small-town Vermont newspaper editor and a mild, rather indolent and somewhat sentimental liberal, worries about the devastation ahead. What can I do? he agonizes night after night. Oh  write another editorial viewing-with-alarm, I suppose!

title: Joe Biden: I Wish to Hell Id Just Kept Saying the Exact Same Thing
description: Joe Bidens personal compartment on the modified Boeing 757 that serves as Air Force Two had the feel of a motel managers office equipped with state-of-the-art communications gear. The room held a little black couch with a pullout bed he had slept on more times than he could count over the last eight years, during which he logged more than a million miles aloft. We were en route back to Wilmington, Del., from Cartagena, Colombia, in early December, and Biden was sitting in a black leather seat with a binder in his lap.

title: Former Apprentice Contestant Sues Trump for Defamation
description: With the filing of her civil sexual harassment suit, will Summer Zervos be Donald J. Trumps Paula Jones?

title: To Obama With Love, and Hate, and Desperation
description: On a recent October morning in the White House mailroom, on the ground floor of the Executive Office Building just beside a loading dock, 10 interns sat at two long tables, each trying to get through 300 letters. Grab a bundle, sit down and read. It was pretty straightforward: Read. A girl doesnt want her mom to be deported, and can the president please help? A guy finally admits to his wife that hes gay, and now he would like to tell the president. A car dealer writes to say his bank is shutting him down, and thanks for nothing, Mr. President. A vet who cant stop seeing what he saw in Iraq writes a barely intelligible rant that makes his point all the more intelligible: Help. An inmate admits to selling crack to all those people but he wants the president to know he is not a lost cause: I have dreams Mr. President, big dreams. A man cant find a job. A woman cant find a job. A teacher with advanced certification cant find a damn job. A lesbian couple just got married; thank you, Mr. President. A man sends his medical bills, a woman sends her student-loan statements, a child sends her drawing of a cat, a mother sends her teenagers report card  straight As, isnt that awesome, Mr. President?

title: How Much Will the Inauguration Cost, and Whos Paying?
description: WASHINGTON  Officials are putting the final touches on what will be nearly a week of celebrations for Donald J. Trumps inauguration as president on Friday. But pomp and circumstance does not come cheap.

title: What Should Senators Ask Scott Pruitt, Trumps E.P.A. Nominee? Heres What Readers Said
description: On Wednesday, the Senate Environment and Public Works Committee will consider President-elect Donald J. Trumps choice  of Scott Pruitt, Oklahomas attorney general since 2011, to lead the Environmental Protection Agency. Mr. Pruitt spent much of his time in office fighting the Obama administration over the E.P.A.s actions to regulate air and water pollution and to curb greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Rubio Challenged Trumps Nominee. But Will He Defy Trump?
description: It was the kind of moment that used to make Republicans think: Senator Marco Rubio will not have to suffer this job for long.

description: How do you cope with the stress of everyday life? How do you relax when there is so little time to do so?
