title: Heineken Sets Sights on Brazil
description: Heineken hopes that Dutch courage will succeed where Japanese adventurism did not. The beer company is in talks to buy the Brazilian unit of Kirin, and may pay $872 million, according to Japanese news media. Landing a deal would give the company close to a 20 percent market share, still well behind its dominant rival, Anheuser-Busch InBev. The target is loss-making, but Heineken has reason to believe it could do a better job.

title: Uber Hires Googles Former Head of Search, Stoking a Rivalry
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Uber and Google have long been bitter rivals in the race to build the autonomous vehicles that appear integral to the future of transportation. Soon, Uber will have a bit of help in that effort from a man who has played a key role in Googles history.

title: A Mystery Gift and an Awkward Moment
description: Melania Trump gave Michelle Obama a gift, which appeared to be from Tiffany. There was much speculation about what was inside.

title: Berluti: Mens Collection
description: The labels mens collection.

title: With Echoes of the 30s, Trump Resurrects a Hard-Line Vision of America First
description: WASHINGTON  America, and the world, just found out what America First means.

title: In Inaugural Address, Trump Continues to Shun Establishment
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps Inaugural Address on Friday was a scalding repudiation of the Washington establishment. The question left hanging after this angry jeremiad: How will the new commander in chief be able to work with these people to govern the country?

title: Who Sang, Spoke or Stood By at Donald J. Trumps Inauguration?
description: The new president was center stage. But viewers of Fridays inauguration found themselves just as interested in some of the side players.

title: Steven Mnuchins $100 Million Oops!
description: To the Editor:

title: Ars Longa, Except When MoMA Throws It Out
description: The New York sculptor Pat Lasch has spent her career making work that plays with the distinction between ordinary things and things belonging in museums: realistic-looking ball gowns made from dried acrylic paint; plaster eggs; towering decorative cakes fashioned from wood and paper.

title: Pretrial Detention Memo for El Chapo
description: In arguing that Joaqun Guzmn Loera should be detained, prosecutors outlined what they say is some of the most significant evidence gathered in the investigation.

title: The 58th Presidential Inaugural Seating Chart
description: A whos who of President Donald J. Trumps Washington.

title: Trumpisms Twitter Wing Celebrates With a DeploraBall
description: Its good to see everyone from Twitter! Mike Cernovich, the author and social-media agitator, shouted into an overdriven microphone on the stage at the National Press Club in Washington, welcoming the more than 1,000 attendees of the sold-out DeploraBall who packed the ballroom floor. There was no dress code, but the men had gravitated toward tuxedos and slim-cut suits and the women to gowns of a vaguely Cruella De Vil aesthetic. Whos on Twitter? Cernovich went on. You know, its so ironic to think: Twitter was in the bag for Hillary Clinton and for Bernie, and we ran Twitter!

title: Artists Reckon With Trumps Inauguration
description: Kelli OHara sang A Cockeyed Optimist. Chita Rivera delivered America. Four more Broadway stars belted out Im a Woman, and a larger group made melody with What the World Needs Now Is Love.

title: Charles Bobo Shaw, Avant-Garde Jazz Drummer, Dies at 69
description: Charles Bobo Shaw, a jazz drummer from St. Louis who worked with major figures of the 1960s and 70s jazz avant-garde, died on Jan. 16 in St. Louis. He was 69.

title: Senate Confirms Mattis at Defense and Kelly for Homeland Security
description: WASHINGTON  Just hours after President Trump was sworn into office, the Senate on Friday confirmed two nominees for critical national security positions, approving James N. Mattis as defense secretary and John F. Kelly as homeland security secretary.

title: Highlights of Paris Mens Fashion Week, So Far
description: The third day of Paris Mens Fashion Week wrapped this afternoon, and so far, a couple of moments have caught the attention of attendees and social media voyeurs. First, Demna Gvasalia, the creative director of Balenciaga, presented a series of pieces inspired by Bernie Sanders, the senator from Vermont who ran for president as a Democrat last year. Later, Louis Vuitton showed a collection made in collaboration with Supreme, the popular street wear label.

title: Mr. Reality TV Goes to Washington
description: Asked by Matt Lauer on Today for some adjectives to describe an Inauguration Day that few people predicted before November, NBCs Chuck Todd offered these: Unusual. Anxious. Uncertain.

title: Who Is Karen Pence? A Brief Introduction to the Second Lady
description: Karen Pence was there with her husband, incoming Vice President Mike Pence, at almost every stop on the campaign trail. And she is with him in Washington on Friday.

title: New York Reactions to Trump Inauguration: Fear and Prayer
description: At the moment when something really big was happening in Washington, Lili Farina, 21, a student, was getting a tattoo of a heart intertwined with a triangle at a tattoo parlor in Manhattan. Sylvia Rhyne, an actress who lives in Brooklyn, was working on some graphic design projects. Beth Kufeld, 46, a reading teacher from the Upper East Side, was at the gym. Juan Perez, 42, who owns a rap music label, was in his apartment on Staten Island taking a shower.

title: Trumps Grim View of the Economy Ignores Most Americans Reality
description: WASHINGTON  The dismal picture of the American economy President Donald J. Trump painted in his Inaugural Address on Friday is at odds with the economic reality of most Americans.

title: Obama Toasts Away His Presidency With Tears and Thanks
description: WASHINGTON  With just hours left in his presidency, Barack Obama toasted about 30 of his closest advisers in the private second-floor residence of the White House  one final chance for a departing president to say goodbye.

title: Donald Trump, Republican Party, Syria: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: U.S. Removes Libya From List of Zones With Looser Rules for Drone Strikes
description: WASHINGTON  Before ceding power, the Obama administration quietly removed a former extremist stronghold in Libya from a list of combat zones where United States counterterrorism drone strikes are authorized without obeying special rules intended to prevent civilian deaths, officials said on Friday.

title: On New Political Footing, Trump Believers Share His Day
description: WASHINGTON  The stars were still out when Tina Difabrizio woke at 2 a.m. Friday, early enough to be sure she would make it from her hotel in Manassas, Va., to a spot of her own on the National Mall.

title: Anti-Trump Protests Across the U.S.
description: The rallies took place in Washington and across the country on Inauguration Day, and some protesters opposing the new president clashed with police in the nation's capital.

title: Trumps Message: Ask What Your Government Has Done to You
description: WASHINGTON  New presidents typically see their Inaugural Address as an opportunity to offer a promise of unity after a bitter election fight or to issue a call to arms to confront urgent economic or security threats. President Trump used his to deliver a stinging indictment of the very government that he had just taken over as its chief executive.

title: Despite Danger, Austrian Course Is a Magnet for Top Skiers
description: KITZBHEL, Austria  Revered as the most dangerous and thrilling downhill course in the world, the Streif  home to the famed Hahnenkamm downhill  has been the scene of countless nasty crashes throughout the years. Last years race was worse than most.

title: U.S. Airstrike Kills More Than 100 Qaeda Fighters in Syria
description: WASHINGTON  As the clock wound down on Barack Obamas presidency, an Air Force B-52 bomber carried out a punishing airstrike against a training camp of Al Qaeda in Syria, the Pentagon said Friday.

title: Canada Today: Political Donations, a Young Captain and Top Films
description: Recently, we looked at two situations involving how Canadian politicians raise money and the murky world of conflicts of interests in politics.

title: Apple Adds to Qualcomms Troubles, Filing Lawsuit Over Rebates
description: SAN FRANCISCO  By mastering some tough computer chip technology and then pulling off an audacious business strategy based on selling its smartphone knowledge, Qualcomm has made billions of dollars and seized influence in the tech industry.

title: N.B.A. Says Referees Missed Key Foul at End of Knicks Loss
description: The N.B.A. fined the Washington Wizards and the assistant coach Sidney Lowe on Friday after Lowe stepped onto the court during the final play of the Knicks 113-110 loss to Washington on Thursday.

title: Trump Declares America First Vision
description: During his inaugural address, President Donald J. Trump laid out a vision for the United States that focused on benefiting American workers and American families.

title: Inaugural Balls: The Trumps First Dance
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump and his wife, Melania, made stops at three official inaugural balls on Friday night, after an Inauguration Day full of celebrations  and protests.

title: Andrew Cuomo to Widen Access to Free Abortion and Contraception
description: Stepping into a period of intense anxiety over the future of the American health care system and reproductive rights, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo plans to announce on Saturday that his administration will require health insurers to cover medically necessary abortions and most forms of contraception at no cost  essentially safeguarding protections currently afforded to women.

title: Brenda Barnes, Pepsi Chief Who Spurred a Work-Life Debate, Dies at 63
description: Brenda Barnes, a two-time corporate chief executive whose decision to leave her top job at Pepsi-Cola sparked a national debate about women juggling career and family, died on Tuesday in Naperville, Ill. She was 63.

title: Miguel Ferrer, Celebrated as a Film and TV Tough Guy, Dies at 61
description: Miguel Ferrer, who followed his mother, Rosemary Clooney, and his Academy Award-winning father, Jose, into acting and often portrayed lawmen and tough guys, died on Thursday at his home in Santa Monica, Calif. He was 61.

title: Falcons Matt Ryan Stays Under the Radar Even as He Flies High
description: Bill Henfey Park, three blocks from the beach in the New Jersey shore town of North Wildwood, is a placid, grassy rectangular expanse with a childrens playground tucked in the corner.

title: Another Day at a Monument to Democracy
description: WASHINGTON  The glorious Lincoln Memorial was closed on Inauguration Day, leaving its white marble inhabitant to inspire from a distance. The monument had served as a backdrop for an inaugural concert the night before, and now, in the late morning, construction workers were methodically removing the silvery bars of scaffolding that imprisoned it.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: This American carnage stops right here and stops right now.

title: With Trump in Charge, Climate Change References Purged From Website
description: WASHINGTON  Within moments of the inauguration of President Trump, the official White House website on Friday deleted nearly all mentions of climate change. The one exception: Mr. Trumps vow to eliminate the Obama administrations climate change policies, which previously had a prominent and detailed web page on whitehouse.gov.

title: Betsy DeVos Wont Shed Stake in Biofeedback Company, Filings Show
description: Betsy DeVos, the billionaire school choice advocate selected by President Donald J. Trump to serve as education secretary, is a strong supporter of using biofeedback technology to help children and teenagers enhance their performance in school.

title: New York Police Officer Defends Fatal Shooting of Unarmed Man, 18
description: A New York police officer facing dismissal for his actions in the fatal shooting of an unarmed man in the Bronx expressed remorse at his disciplinary trial on Friday, but said his actions were justified.

title: Hillary Clinton Is Stoic at Her Rivals Inauguration
description: WASHINGTON  This was not the inauguration Hillary Clinton thought she would be attending. Some Democrats, still bitter about her election night defeat, grumbled privately that she should have skipped Donald J. Trumps swearing-in, as 60 House Democrats did on Friday. But a groundswell of supporters praised her fortitude.

title: What President Trump Doesnt Get About America
description: President Trump presented such a graceless and disturbingly ahistoric vision of America on Friday that his Inaugural Address cast more doubt than hope on his presidency.

title: Many Left. Many Arrived. All Felt the Mood of a New Era.
description: WASHINGTON  The people gathered in natures gloom, squinting through a spitting rain, sizing up the man and his moment, in a city disinclined to welcome either.

title: Madonna and Marilyn Minter Discuss Art and Protest
description: At Billboard Magazines Women in Music event last month, Madonna lamented the defeat of Hillary Clinton. But on Thursday night at a panel discussion with the artist Marilyn Minter at the Brooklyn Museum, she offered another perspective on Donald J. Trumps election victory: She said it had an upside, because it inspired Americans to wake up and stop taking their freedoms for granted.

title: Fox News Hires Nigel Farage, a Trump Ally Who Backed Brexit
description: Minutes before Donald J. Trump took the oath of office on Friday, Fox News announced that Nigel Farage, the right-wing British politician, would join the network as a paid on-air contributor. The move provides an unlikely American megaphone for Mr. Farage, a chief architect of the campaign in Britain to leave the European Union and a friend of Mr. Trump, who can now command the audience of the countrys most-watched cable-news network.

title: Trump Embraces the Look of the Presidency
description: WASHINGTON  Donald J. Trump, proudly unpresidential in word and tweet during the transition, readily embraced the pomp-and-patriotism visuals of the presidency on Friday.

title: A Nation Divided at Inauguration
description: Stand between supporters and protesters as Donald J. Trump is sworn in as the 45th president of the United States.

title: The First Dance
description: President Trump attended two official inaugural balls, as well as the Armed Services Ball.

title: At the Inauguration With Millennials for Trump
description: Washington  Adam Anderson bet big on the Donald Trump movement.

title: Trump Issues Executive Order Scaling Back Parts of Obamacare
description: WASHINGTON  In his first executive order, President Trump on Friday directed government agencies to scale back as many aspects of the Affordable Care Act as possible, moving within hours of being sworn in to fulfill his pledge to eviscerate Barack Obamas signature health care law.

title: Its Not for Wimps: 8 Stuntwomen Reflect on Their Careers
description: Theres a certain method to being set on fire from head to toe. Or falling down a flight of stairs. In a tube top. And high heels.

title: How Ya Holding Up?
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Its not often that a crossword puzzle both checks in with you on how youre doing (FEEL O.K.?) and backhands you with a quasi-insult (I HOPE YOURE HAPPY), but for my money, its at least proof that it cares. You can also tell because it has KIND EYES.

title: Distraught Yet Upbeat, Broadway Stars Give Concert for America
description: For 150 minutes, no one mentioned Donald J. Trump.

title: Trumps Inauguration Was No Woodstock
description: WASHINGTON  Except for the cold weather, Barack Obamas first inauguration reminded me a lot of Woodstock. Throngs of revelers wandering around with no idea whatsoever of where they were going. The crowd was so big, you worried that thered be a stampede. But no. People bumped into one another, smiled and bumped on. One big beaming community. Peace, love and thermal underwear.

title: What the Womens March Stands For
description: Affordable birth control. Equal pay for equal work. Full access to health care for transgender Americans.

title: Why Trumpism May Not Endure
description: Donald J. Trump enjoyed a rare satisfaction for a newly inaugurated president  waving goodbye not just to one vanquished rival, but to three.

title: A Day of Triumph and Tears
description: A look at the boisterous celebrations and sometimes violent protests that marked Donald J. Trump's first day as president.

title: In Chapos Extradition, a Lesson for Mr. Trump
description: It was not a coincidence. In the waning hours of the Obama presidency, officials in Mexico bundled the drug kingpin Joaqun Guzmn Loera, known as El Chapo, into an airplane and handed him to the American government so he could stand trial in New York.

title: For Baseballs Hall of Fame, Do Statistics Alone Still Matter?
description: Its a line weve all heard, and have probably said to our kids. It starts with there will always be someone and concludes with a word like faster or stronger or prettier or smarter. Its supposed to insulate our silver-lined dream clouds with the spray foam of pragmatism. It tells us that we cannot win them all, not just because of the statistical gods, but because of the gods of creation. Some people were simply born with more talent, and they are apparently all over the earth. Humility is the lesson.

title: Corrections: January 21, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: South Korea Arrests 2 Presidential Aides Over Blacklist of Artists
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Two of President Park Geun-hyes closest aides, including her culture minister, were arrested Saturday on charges that they were involved in drawing up a blacklist of thousands of artists and writers deemed unfriendly to Ms. Park and excluding them from government-controlled support programs.

title: Despite Sabbath, Ivanka Trump and Husband Celebrate Inauguration
description: For Ivanka Trump and her husband, Jared Kushner, celebrating the presidential inauguration by attending the gatherings on Friday night posed an obstacle to their Orthodox Jewish observance of the Sabbath.

title: El Chapos Extradition Draws Tinge of Regret in Chicago
description: CHICAGO  In this city, Joaqun Guzmn Loera, the drug lord called El Chapo, is also known simply as Public Enemy No. 1. The last time the Chicago Crime Commission bestowed that title, it was on Al Capone.

title: Looking for Englands Next Soccer Phenom? The Adidas Scout Knows
description: MANCHESTER, England  Neale McDermotts record as a soccer talent spotter is better than most. Long before Dele Alli was Dele Alli, when he was just a 16-year-old of raw promise at the lower-tier team Milton Keynes Dons, rather than Tottenhams standard-bearer and Englands nascent superstar, he was on McDermotts radar.

title: Star Trek Copyright Settlement Allows Fan Film to Proceed
description: It was a legal battle worthy of a Federation starship taking on a Klingon destroyer.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: Aziz Ansari in S.N.L. and Idina Menzel in Beaches
description: Aziz Ansari, a vocal opponent of Donald J. Trump, makes his Saturday Night Live hosting debut in the first post-inauguration episode. And Idina Menzel reprises Wind Beneath My Wings in the Lifetime remake of Beaches.

title: Leaders Abroad, Joyful or Wary, Face Uncertainty of Trump Era
description: MEXICO CITY  There was dismay in Britain, applause in Russia and silence in Japan. French populists found hope, Mexican leaders expressed concern and Germanys vice chancellor offered an allusion to his countrys dark past.

title: I Do Not Recall Feeling So Anxious or Powerless
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment.

title: Womens March Highlights as Huge Crowds Protest Trump: Were Not Going Away
description: Hundreds of thousands of women gathered in Washington on Saturday in a kind of counterinauguration after President Trump took office on Friday. A range of speakers and performers cutting across generational lines rallied near the Capitol before marchers made their way toward the White House.

title: A Mortgage Lender Digs In Its Heels
description: Quicken Loans has come under regulatory scrutiny. But it is playing a big role in the revitalization of Detroit..

title: Quicken Loans, the New Mortgage Machine
description: DETROIT  A low buzz fills the air as an army of mortgage bankers, perched below floating canopies in a kaleidoscope of vivid pinks, blues, purples and greens, works the phones, promising borrowers easy financing and low rates for home loans.

title: At Student Loan Giant Navient, Troubled Past Was Prologue
description: Deception. Cheating. Shortcuts.

title: The Matriarch Behind Beyonc and Solange
description: For sisters in the public eye, Beyonc and Solange Knowles have managed to resist the siren call to overshare the minutiae of their personal lives. But there is one topic they are happy to gush about: their mother, Tina Knowles Lawson.

title: Chelsey Gates and Matthew Geula: Beach Buddies, and a Dog With a Camera
description: Chelsey Paige Gates, the daughter of Jodi L. Stievelman of Delray Beach, Fla., and Donny Deutsch of New York, was married Jan. 21 to Matthew Gabriel Geula, the son of Joan A. Geula and Dr. Robert H. Geula of New York. Rabbi Rachel Aranoff officiated at the Pierre hotel in New York.

title: These Young Adult Novels Come With Back Stories: The Authors Own
description: ATLANTA  Allison Glock and T Cooper live behind a white picket fence, an enclosure so tidy and welcoming that it seems to grin at passers-by. Its cheer is a match for their house, warmed on the inside by an upright piano, a plump sofa facing the weathered wood fireplace, and family portraits lining the walls. This is home, you may imagine, to the quintessential American family, living contentedly behind its clapboard facade.

title: Sacai: Mens Collection
description: The labels mens collection.

title: A Chief Executive Whose Office Is Wherever She Happens to Be
description: A smartphone, a laptop and other devices allow Deborah Schwarz of the LAC Group to get her work done while shes on the move. See how.

title: A Little Variety
description: VARIETY PUZZLES  This weeks puzzles include:

title: Copenhagen Street Style
description: I was attracted to the people who kind of broke the traditional stereotype of what we think of Scandinavians, said Jake Michaels, a photographer from Los Angeles, who spent part of last month in Copenhagen. Here are some street looks that made an impression.

title: Mikes and Sapnas Week in Tech: There are Zombie Social Networks. Then Theres Facebook.
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry. Farhad is away this week, so Sapna Maheshwari, a Times media reporter, is filling in.

title: Womens March on Washington
description: A mass demonstration meant to challenge President Trumps administration is taking place in Washington on the day after the inauguration.

title: When Is a Love Connection a Conflict of Interest?
description: Q. The superintendent and the president of our Upper West Side condominium board have started a romantic relationship. The president claims that there is no conflict of interest and has offered to be recused from any decisions involving the super. But because the super is the buildings only employee, most building issues involve the super in one way or another. It would thus seem that conflicts of interest are inevitable and that the presidents claim is not entirely accurate. Can this relationship continue with these two in their current positions?

title: The President Who Buried Humility
description: WASHINGTON  The word popped up in the opening sentence of Barack Obamas first Inaugural Address and in the opening paragraphs of George W. Bushs.

title: Melania Trumps America First Inaugural Wardrobe
description: WASHINGTON  In the end, she checked every box.

title: The Opposite of Carnage
description: Trumps inaugural speech was, of course, full of lies  pretty much the same lies that marked the campaign. Above all, there was the portrayal of a dystopia of social and economic collapse that bears little relationship to American reality. During the campaign Trump got away with this in part because of slovenly, craven media, but also because of persistent misperceptions. The public consistently believes that crime is rising even when it has been falling to historical lows; it believes that the number of uninsured has risen when it has also fallen to historic lows; Republicans believe that unemployment is up and, incredibly, the stock market down under Obama.

title: After Escape From Syria, Another Dangerous Foe: Diabetes
description: MAFRAQ, Jordan  Nisreen al-Najjar thought the worst was behind her family when it fled to Jordan from war-torn Homs in Syria.

title: Inaugural Speech Dims G.O.P. Hopes for a More Conservative Trump Agenda
description: WASHINGTON  One topic has dominated conversations among elected Republicans since President Trumps stunning victory: Will he actually pursue his campaign agenda of big-government nationalism, all but obliterating the liberal-conservative distinctions that have defined Americas political parties for a century?

title: Womens March Highlights: Viewer Questions
description: We brought you live to Womens Marches around the country. You commented with your questions, and NYT reporters on the scene asked them and responded in real time.

title: Rafael Nadal Embraces the Present to Advance in Australian Open
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Lets wait a little bit, no? Rafael Nadal said, snapping his fingers after reaching the fourth round of the Australian Open when asked to explain what impact his new adviser Carlos Moya was having on his game.

title: High Hopes on the National Mall
description: WASHINGTON  They want him to build that wall. To bring back manufacturing jobs. To lower health care premiums. To increase military spending.

title: Dior Homme: Mens Collection
description: The labels mens collection.

title: A Third of Afghans Will Need Aid This Year, U.N. Says
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The United Nations on Saturday issued an appeal for more than half a billion dollars in humanitarian aid to Afghans feeling the brunt of an intensifying conflict, with officials saying that a staggering one-third of the countrys population would require assistance in the year ahead.

title: Trump Inspires Cheers, and Alarm, Around the World
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria  The inaugural meeting of the European Trump Society packed the central aisle of a bookstore in Bulgarias capital, Sofia, on Friday evening  women in furs, men in ski jackets, the floor glistening with melted snow. A live feed from the crowded steps of the United States Capitol filled a projection screen on the back wall.

title: Defeated Gambian Leader Ends Standoff and Boards a Flight Into Exile
description: BANJUL, Gambia  As a military band played, the defeated president of Gambia, who had set off a tense standoff by refusing to step down after his election loss, left the country on Saturday night, boarding a flight that would send him into exile.

title: Variety: Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Many people love Marx Brothers movies and the work of GROUCHO, the INTELLECTUAL BROTHER, but few know that he was politically opinionated. One of his best quotes on the subject was Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly and applying the wrong remedies.

title: Historians Latest Book on Mao Turns Acclaim in China to Censure
description: BEIJING  It seemed that Chinas censors had finally muzzled Yang Jisheng, the famed chronicler of the Mao era. Last year, he had finished writing a widely anticipated history of the Cultural Revolution. But officials warned him against publishing it and barred him from traveling to the United States, he has said, and he stayed muted through the 50th anniversary of the start of that bloody upheaval.

title: Inauguration, From Morning to Night
description: Journey through the inauguration of Donald J. Trump with this interactive video gallery.

title: Pakistani Taliban Claim Deadly Market Bombing
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  A bombing killed at least 20 people on Saturday during an auction at a vegetable market in a mostly Shiite town in northwestern Pakistan, ending a long lull in militant violence there, officials said.

title: Avalanche Death Toll in Italy Reaches 5 as Search of Hotel Rubble Continues
description: ROME  Rescue workers on Saturday pulled three more bodies from the rubble and snow that covered an isolated hotel in the Apennine Mountains in central Italy when it was struck by an avalanche caused by an earthquake on Wednesday.

title: As U.S. Cedes Leadership on Climate, Others Step Up at Davos
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  When the chief executive of Saudi Arabias national oil and gas company mapped out a glowing future for fossil fuels at a discussion in Davos this past week, dissent came from an unexpected corner of the room.

title: What Does Trumps Executive Order Against Obamacare Actually Do?
description: Donald J. Trump ran on a campaign promise to dismantle the Affordable Care Act. So it should not come as a surprise that he has signed an executive order urging his administration to fight it as much as possible.

title: Pictures From the 2017 Womens Marches on Every Continent
description: Crowds in hundreds of cities around the world gathered in conjunction with the Womens March on Washington.

title: Trumps Improvised Path to a Month of Executive Action
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump plans to take executive action on a nearly daily basis for a month to unravel his predecessors legacy and begin enacting his own agenda, his aides say, part of an extended exercise of presidential power to quickly make good on his campaign promises.

title: On the Golden State Warriors Bench, Life Is Good
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  The last player on the bench for the best team in basketball was the first to arrive at the teams training facility on a recent weekend morning. James Michael McAdoo turned on the stereo, laced up his sneakers and joined three members of the Golden State Warriors video department for a workout before practice.

title: Jared Kushner, Trumps Son-in-Law, Is Cleared to Serve as Adviser
description: WASHINGTON  Hours after President Trump took his oath on Friday, the Justice Department issued an opinion saying that his appointment of his son-in-law, Jared Kushner, as a senior White House adviser would be lawful despite a federal antinepotism law.

title: In Solidarity: Women's Marches Across the World
description: Thousands of people marched in solidarity with American women in Washington in support of equal rights. Listen to voices from Sydney, Cape Town, Bangalore and London.

title: How Marches in Washington Have Shaped America
description: One of the great weapons of a democracy.

title: How to Listen to Donald Trump Every Day for Years
description: Donald J. Trumps Inaugural Address had moments of what we could call rhetoric. The bit about the kid in Detroit and the kid on the windswept plains of Nebraska  black and white, get it?  looking up at the same night sky. Overall, though, there was the air of a diligent adolescent trying to put something down on paper but not quite hitting the mark. America is totally unstoppable sounds like a schoolyard brag. We will bring back our borders  where did they go? The very sad depletion of our military  its impossible to imagine Barack Obama, or even George W. Bush, phrasing it that way in a written speech.

title: Why 2017 May Be the Best Year Ever
description: Theres a broad consensus that the world is falling apart, with every headline reminding us that life is getting worse.

title: The Limits of Law in China
description: The Chinese Constitution is clear about the rule of law. No organization or individual is privileged to be beyond the Constitution or other laws, declares Article 5. And Article 126 says, The peoples courts exercise judicial power independently, in accordance with the provisions of law, and not subject to interference by any administrative organ, public organization or individual.

title: In Beijing, and Washington, a Breath of Foul Air
description: When friends cautioned me about Beijings notorious air pollution recently, ahead of my first visit there, I brushed it off. It was an old story, and having grown up in northern New Jersey in the era of unregulated industrial air pollution and open garbage burning on the Meadowlands, I figured I could handle it. But I began to have second thoughts on the flight in from the north, when we crossed a mountain ridge and the clear air turned instantly to dense smog. It was still 20 minutes to touchdown.

title: Local Police Need Federal Oversight. Exhibit A: Chicago
description: President Donald Trumps nominee for attorney general, Jeff Sessions, has been sharply critical of the Obama administrations tactic of forcing local law enforcement agencies to end unconstitutional police practices by threatening to haul them into court.

title: The Republican Health Care Con
description: Republicans say the Affordable Care Act provides health insurance that manages to be both lousy and expensive. Whatever the flaws of these policies, the new Trump administration is trying to pull off a con by offering Americans coverage that is likely to be so much worse that it would barely deserve the name insurance. It would also leave many millions without the medical care they need.

title: Free Markets and Health Care
description: Readers object to the idea of competition to meet personal and societal medical needs.

title: Racial Progress Is Real. But So Is Racist Progress.
description: Barack Obama said in his final news conference that he planned to use his time off from politics to do some writing. I am hoping in his post-presidency, he begins to write a different racial history from the one he proclaimed from his presidential pulpit.

title: Why I Cannot Fall in Line Behind Trump
description: A year ago, I declared on these pages that despite being a Republican my whole life, I would not under any circumstances vote for Donald J. Trump for president. Since then, Ive been asked by other Republicans if I kept that promise (I did) and whether I regret it (I dont).

title: Does Breast Milk Have a Sex Bias?
description: In 1973, the biologist Robert Trivers and the computer scientist Dan Willard made a striking prediction about parents and their offspring. According to the principles of evolutionary theory, they argued, the male-to-female ratio of offspring should not be 50-50 (as chance would dictate), but rather should vary as a function of how good (or bad) the conditions are in which the parents find themselves.

title: Barnum & Bailey Make Room for a New Ringmaster
description: Since the early 1870s, the elephant has symbolized both the circus and the Republican Party, so the announcement on Jan. 14 that Ringling Brothers and Barnum & Bailey was folding its tent after 146 years evoked inevitable political metaphors.

title: The Tempting of the Media
description: There are two common views among journalists about the fate of our profession under the presidency of Donald Trump. The first is that ours is an age of maximal danger for the freedom of the press, that Trumps war on newspapers and networks will escalate from tweets to Erdoganian crackdowns, that truly independent journalism will be marginalized while the White House breeds a lap dog press.

title: The America We Lost When Trump Won
description: NO, Im not over it.

title: Trump Speaks at the C.I.A.
description: President Trump makes his first remarks to the C.I.A.

title: Marine Le Pen Extols Far Right During Speech in Germany
description: KOBLENZ, Germany  Marine Le Pen wasted no time in proclaiming 2017 as the year of far-right awakening in Europe.

title: A Colonial-Era Wound Opens in Namibia
description: SWAKOPMUND, Namibia  The statue, depicting a German marine holding a rifle in his hands and standing guard over a dying comrade, has stood undisturbed for decades in the most prominent spot in Swakopmund, a city on Namibias coast.

title: Off Long Island, Wind Power Tests the Waters
description: Only a few years ago, the long-held dream of harnessing the strong, steady gusts off the Atlantic coast to make electricity seemed destined to remain just that. Proposals for offshore wind farms foundered on the shoals of high costs, regulatory hurdles and the fierce opposition of those who didnt want giant industrial machinery puncturing the pristine ocean views.

title: San Francisco Asks: Where Have All the Children Gone?
description: SAN FRANCISCO  In a compact studio apartment on the fringes of the Castro district here a young couple live with their demanding 7-year-old, whom they dote on and take everywhere: a Scottish terrier named Olive.

title: Finding Myself Marching
description: WASHINGTON  My mother had one piece of advice for me when I was in my 20s: Dont marry until youre at least 30. I used to laugh when shed say it. Marriage was far from my mind, a distant goal, if anything  something I certainly felt could wait.

title: After Silent Period, Park Service Says It Regrets 2 Trump-Related Retweets
description: The National Park Service said on Saturday it regretted having retweeted two Twitter posts, including one comparing the size of crowds at President Trumps inauguration on Friday with President Obamas in 2009.

title: Herms: Mens Collection
description: The labels mens collection.

title: Fashion in the Age of Trump
description: Vanessa Friedman, chief fashion critic for The New York Times, weighs in on the styles seen on Inauguration Day.

title: The Internet of Things Is Coming for Us
description: The Moche people lived on Perus north coast long before the Spanish conquest of the Americas. They grew corn and squash, built monumental adobe temples and were master craftsmen in gold and ceramics.

title: Mishmash
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Dan Schoenholz is back with a unique theme that involves mashing words together. Lets take a look.

title: With False Claims, Trump Attacks Media on Turnout and Intelligence Rift
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump used his first full day in office on Saturday to unleash a remarkably bitter attack on the news media, falsely accusing journalists of both inventing a rift between him and intelligence agencies and deliberately understating the size of his inauguration crowd.

title: What the Marchers in Washington Want
description: Many of those marching in Washington on Saturday were concerned about their futures under President Trump. They worried about the administration turning back the clock on hard-won civil rights and reproductive rights. Here are some of the women and men who joined the protest and the messages they carried for the new president.

title: Women March Around the U.S.
description: Hundreds of thousands of women came out to march in Washington, D.C. There were also hundreds of solidarity marches held around the nation and the world.

title: Defiant Voices Flood U.S. Cities as Women Rally for Rights
description: WASHINGTON  The day after what many had assumed would be the inauguration of the first female president, hundreds of thousands of women flooded the streets of Washington, and many more marched in cities across the country, in defiant, jubilant rallies against the man who defeated her.

title: In a Rust Belt Town, the Womens March Draws Shrugs and Cheers From Afar
description: NILES, Mich.  When Jennifer Purucker, 31, was asked on Saturday morning what she thought of the Womens March on Washington, she took a sip of coffee and shook her head. Never heard of it, she said.

title: In Trumps Hometown, a Clear Message of Defiance From Women
description: New Yorkers flooded the streets of Manhattan on Saturday aiming to send a message to President Trump that his hometown would be a center of resistance during his administration.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: If you get to the age that youre going to have kids in San Francisco and you havent made your million  or more  you probably begin to think you have to leave.

title: Maggie Roche, Who Harmonized With Her Singing Sisters, Dies at 65
description: Maggie Roche, the songwriter whose serene alto anchored the close harmonies of the Roches, her trio with her sisters, Terre and Suzzy, died on Saturday. She was 65.

title: A New Administration. A New Era. But That Cake Looks Familiar.
description: Late Friday night, after a day of celebrations for President Trumps inauguration, the pastry chef and TV personality Duff Goldman noticed something familiar: One of Mr. Trumps three official inaugural balls  A Salute to Our Armed Services  featured a cake that looked exactly like one he had made for Barack Obamas inauguration four years ago.

title: Corrections: January 22, 2017
description: THE MAGAZINE

title: Ball Rolls Out, and Knicks Again Roll Over, Falling to Suns
description: The Knicks Carmelo Anthony sat on the scorers table at Madison Square Garden on Saturday night. His coach, Jeff Hornacek, walked by and offered a half-hug. One by one, a few teammates consoled him as well. A young fan in an orange Anthony jersey patted him on the back.

title: Three Generations of Women, Marching on Washington
description: For Amber Coleman-Mortley, the Womens March on Washington was a family affair.

title: Marchers Pour Into Washington to Pour Out Their Hearts
description: WASHINGTON  They came on buses from Chicago and trains from New York. They flew from Phoenix, Nashville and St. Louis. They drove from all over the East Coast, mobbing rest areas on the New Jersey Turnpike with swarms of pink hats.

title: Attack on Alt-Right Leader Has Internet Asking: Is It O.K. to Punch a Nazi?
description: Is it O.K. to punch a Nazi?

title: Lynnette Cortes, Miheer Mhatre
description: Lynnette Cortes and Miheer Vilas Mhatre were married Jan. 21 at Fountains Country Club in Lake Worth, Fla. The Rev. Hector Escobar, a pastor at Trinity Church International, officiated.

title: Jennifer Sloan, Colette Montoya-Humphrey
description: Jennifer Catherine Sloan and Colette Denali Montoya-Humphrey were married Jan. 18 at the Santa Fe County Commission Chambers in Santa Fe, N.M. Shannon Broderick Bulman, a Santa Fe County probate judge, officiated.

title: Jennifer Costello, Ryan de Ridder
description: Jennifer Marie Costello and Ryan James de Ridder were married Jan. 21 at Black Canyon Inn in Estes Park, Colo. Peter Goodrich, a friend of the couple who became a minister with American Marriage Ministries for the occasion, officiated.

title: Cynthia Watson, Bernard Cole
description: Cynthia Ann Watson and Bernard David Cole were married Jan. 20 at the home of their friends Janet Norton and Capt. Douglas M. Norton, in Annapolis, Md. The brides brother, J. Scott Watson, who is licensed by the State of Maryland to perform weddings, officiated.

title: Amelia Chass, Leonardo Alcivar
description: Amelia Ters Chass and Leonardo Alcivar were married Jan. 21 at St. Josephs Church in Stockbridge, Mass. James McElroy, a Roman Catholic deacon, performed the ceremony.

title: Katherine Girardi, George Kentros
description: Katherine Elizabeth Girardi, a daughter of Joan D. Girardi and Gerald J. Girardi of Scarsdale, N.Y., was married Jan. 21 to George Athan Kentros, a son of Dr. Mary K. Kentros and Arthur G. Kentros, also of Scarsdale. Mark R. Giller, a Sanctuary of the Beloved minister, officiated at the JW Marriott Essex House in New York.

title: Alexis Danneman, Joshua Boehm
description: Alexis Elizabeth Danneman and Joshua Lee Boehm were married Jan. 21 at the Camelback Inn in Paradise Valley, Ariz. Judge Michael Daly Hawkins of the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit in San Francisco officiated.

title: Kevin Turners Parents Still Watch Football. But Differently.
description: HOLTVILLE, Ala.  In an airy, four-bedroom house here on Jordan Lake about 25 miles north of Montgomery and around the corner from cotton farms, there is a 90-inch flat-screen television on the living room wall.

title: Venus Williams, in Classic Form, Eases Into Australian Open Quarterfinals
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Nearly two decades after her debut at Melbourne Park, Venus Williams has made a vintage run to return to the quarterfinals of the Australian Open for the ninth time. She beat the 181st-ranked qualifier Mona Barthel, 6-3, 7-5, in a fourth-round match Sunday afternoon at Rod Laver Arena.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Secrets of the Six Wives and the Rolling Stones
description: The historian Lucy Worsley enters the bedchambers of Henry VIII and his six wives. And the Rolling Stones rock on with the masses in Havana in a free concert.

title: Witness the Womens March in Washington
description: Attend the rally that drew hundreds of thousands to the nations capital in protest of President Trump.

title: Trump on Saturday Night Live? Nope. Its Putin and Ansari.
description: In its first new episode under the presidency of Donald J. Trump, Saturday Night Live opened with its vision of the most powerful man in the world  President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, smirking and chiding Mr. Trump for early missteps  followed by a monologue from the shows host, Aziz Ansari, who commented on issues of race in post-Obama America and implored Mr. Trump to directly address them himself.

title: Aziz Ansaris Monologue on Saturday Night Live: Transcript
description: The actor and comedian Aziz Ansari delivered the first Saturday Night Live monologue under President Donald J. Trump, lampooning him as the Chris Brown of politics but also urging him to confront a new, lower-case K.K.K. movement in America. Mr. Ansari (Master of None, Parks and Recreation) was the first S.N.L. host of South Asian descent, and, in an episode infused with Trump material, he frequently drew on his background to talk and joke about race during his eight-and-a-half-minute monologue. Here is the full transcript.

title: Australian Open Upsets Knock Out No. 1s, Andy Murray and Angelique Kerber
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Three days after the six-time Australian Open champion Novak Djokovic bowed out in the tournaments second round, top-ranked Andy Murray followed.

title: With French Socialists in Crisis, Manuel Valls and Benot Hamon Head to Runoff
description: BOISSEUIL, France  A furious Jean-Marc Ducourtioux shouted with his fellow union members as they banged on the plexiglass window of a meeting hall in small-town France. Inside was Manuel Valls, the former Socialist prime minister, who was campaigning for president in this bastion of the French left.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $750,000
description: 184 Clinton Avenue, #Garden1, Clinton Hill

title: Crowd Scientists Say Womens March in Washington Had 3 Times as Many People as Trumps Inauguration
description: Estimates by crowd scientists of attendance at events on Friday and Saturday and how they calculated it.

title: Donald Trumps Inauguration, Womens March: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Lanvin: Mens Collection
description: The label shows their fall 2017 designs.

title: Hirakhand Express Train Derails in Southern India, Killing Dozens
description: NEW DELHI  At least 36 passengers were killed in a train derailment in southern India on Saturday night, the latest disaster on Indias old and overburdened railway system.

title: At Least 18 Die as Tornadoes Sweep Southeast U.S.
description: ATLANTA  At least 18 people were killed and 43 more injured in Georgia and Mississippi after thunderstorms and tornadoes roared through the South this weekend, leaving some things standing and some things fallen, some lives whole and others blown to bits.

title: Retired Big Apple Circus Animals Prepare for Their Second Act
description: WINDHAM, N.Y.  See the mailbox? This is hallowed starlet ground.

title: The Future of Male Beauty at the Mens Wear Shows in Paris
description: PARIS  If the state of masculinity was in play during this mens wear cycle, as designers like Pierpaolo Piccioli of Valentino asserted in a backstage interview, you could have fooled this viewer.

title: Earning a Degree, and Her Daughters Admiration
description: It was as though time had stood still at Latisha Hopewells apartment in Lower Manhattan. A colorfully decorated Christmas tree again stood near the entrance of her mostly unadorned apartment. Freshly opened presents for her daughters, Shaun and Shani Bates, were stacked beneath the tree, as the girls sat next to their mother on a large, green sofa in their living room.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Theresa May Is Grilled Over U.K. Missile Test Failure
description: LONDON  Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain refused to comment on Sunday about the reported failure of an unarmed British Trident missile that was test-fired from a submarine off the coast of Florida in June.

title: Another Australian Open Surprise: The Return of the Old Roger Federer
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  A Grand Slam tournament that had already taken one big unexpected turn became a genuinely wild ride on Sunday as Andy Murray and Angelique Kerber, the worlds No. 1 singles players, were beaten by unseeded opposition in the fourth round. Roger Federer, meanwhile, continued to do an excellent impression of vintage Roger Federer.

title: A Club Where Lions Dance and Traditions Take Root
description: The first thing you notice in the stairwell to the fourth-floor studio on Canal Street in Manhattan is the measured thumping coming from behind a metal door.

title: Once a Leading Foe of Tobacco, New York Lags Under de Blasio
description: In the 12 years that Michael R. Bloomberg spent as mayor of New York, he became known for pushing far-reaching health initiatives to curb smoking and change eating habits  challenging Big Tobacco, big sodas and, at times, the will of New Yorkers.

title: 7 Questions for Gambias New President, Adama Barrow
description: One of these days, the West African nation of Gambia will get to see its new president, Adama Barrow, in the flesh.

title: Baseball Tragedy: Two Players Die in Crashes in the Dominican Republic
description: When Yordano Ventura won Game 6 of the 2014 World Series for the Kansas City Royals, he wore the initials of Oscar Taveras on his cap. Taveras, an outfielder for the St. Louis Cardinals, had just been killed in a car accident in the Dominican Republic, the homeland they shared.

title: At Lanvin, a Lot More Than Nothing
description: PARIS  As a team, as a cause, as an ideal, its hard to root for nothing.

title: Trumps Vow to Repeal Health Law Revives Talk of High-Risk Pools
description: Joanne Fitzgerald was getting divorced and was stressed out. When stomach pain kicked in, she saw a doctor to have it checked out.

title: Art-House Fare Hopes for an Oscar-Nod Push, as Split Rules North America
description: Nominations for the 89th Academy Awards will be announced on Tuesday, and movie marketers will be ready to pounce with ads that try to coax more people into seats: The establishment is swooning! Get to a theater!

title: Its the Falcons (2nd Super Bowl) vs. the Patriots (9th Super Bowl)
description: The New England Patriots will compete in their N.F.L.-record ninth Super Bowl on Sunday, Feb. 5 in Houston, matched up against Matt Ryan and the Atlanta Falcons top-ranked offense. Heres what to look for in Super Bowl LI:

title: Donald Trump, Yahya Jammeh, Astana: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Undersea Museum Keeps Fish Feeding and Its Social Commentary Biting
description: LANZAROTE, Spain  In the dim underwater light, a man lies on a funeral pyre, his arms outstretched. He is not a real person, but a statue created by Jason deCaires Taylor, a British sculptor whose works form Europes first underwater museum, here on Lanzarote.

title: G.O.P. Senators Hope to Speed Trump Cabinet Confirmations
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Republicans will move this week to speed the confirmation of President Trumps cabinet, an effort that has been stymied by the combination of lax preparation by Mr. Trumps transition team, his many unorthodox nominees and Democrats spoiling for a fight, albeit with few cards in their deck.

title: Thom Browne: Mens Collection
description: The label shows their fall 2017 designs.

title: Cubans Newly Blocked at U.S. Border Place Hopes in Trump
description: NUEVO LAREDO, Mexico  She spent weeks hiking through the Amazon, crossing a crocodile-filled river. She scaled border walls, escaped from immigration detention in Panama and slept in a church. Broke, hungry and exhausted, she found refuge with indigenous people in the jungle who took her in and fed her for a week.

title: How Vital Are Women? This Town Found Out as They Left to March
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  The Starbucks coffee shop on South Park Street was populated in the first hours of daylight on Saturday, but almost exclusively by men. The owner of the JaiPure Yoga Studio on Bloomfield Avenue reported a drop-off in participation of about 25 percent.

title: Comparing Inauguration Crowds
description: President Trump and his press secretary disputed estimates of attendance at his inauguration, but footage from Fridays event, compared with those from President Barack Obamas 2009 inauguration, showed a different story.

title: White House Pushes Alternative Facts. Here Are the Real Ones.
description: WASHINGTON  Kellyanne Conway, counselor to President Trump, said on NBCs Meet the Press on Sunday that the White House had put forth alternative facts to ones reported by the news media about the size of Mr. Trumps inauguration crowd.

title: Declaration on Gambias Political Situation
description: The United Nations and Ecowas, an association of West African states, issued a document in the hope of ensuring an orderly transition of power in Gambia, after Yahya Jammeh, the incumbent president, resisted ceding his office to Adama Barrow, who defeated him in a presidential election in December.

title: Tilt Kids Festival Returns With 8 Premieres
description: The Tilt Kids Festival, a collaboration between the French Institute Alliance Franaise and Cultural Services of the French Embassy that had its debut last year, will return in March with a lineup that features eight premieres, including new work from the circus collective involved in the 2013 Broadway revival of Pippin.

title: BroadwayCon Faces Dispute With Actors Equity Association
description: Last January, the first BroadwayCon brought thousands of theater fans to New York despite a massive snowstorm. But one week before the conventions expanded second iteration, organizers have hit a snag: a labor dispute with the Actors Equity Association, who has asked its members not to perform, or even rehearse, for the event until an agreement is reached.

title: After Success of Womens March, a Question Remains: Whats Next?
description: More than a million people who turned out on Saturday for womens marches in all 50 states have put down their placards, taken off their pink hats and ended their chants after what was an extraordinary display of dissent against the Trump presidency.

title: When Your Loved Ones Voted the Other Way
description: We asked parents and children who voted for opposing candidates to discuss their hopes and fears for the country  and for each other  over the course of the next four years.

title: Ex-Homeland Security Chief to Rejoin New York Law Firm
description: Jeh C. Johnson, who has stepped down as secretary of Homeland Security, is rejoining the New York law firm Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison, where he formerly worked. He will be a partner in the firms litigation department.

title: Rita Moreno Aims to Hit the Right Accent on One Day at a Time
description: Rita Moreno sits among rare company. In addition to her memorable roles  West Side Story, The King and I, The Electric Company  theres the EGOT. Ms. Moreno, 85, has won an Emmy, a Grammy, an Oscar and a Tony (hence the acronym). Only about a dozen people have done so.

title: Gambia Is Back Again, but Its New Leader Is Still in Senegal
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Four days into his term, tucked into a sofa 150 miles outside the country he was elected to rule, President Adama Barrow of Gambia pledged on Sunday to improve his countrys economy, free its political prisoners and create a commission to look into the brutal legacy of his predecessor.

title: From Jingles to Pop Hits, A.I. Is Music to Some Ears
description: LONDON  Patrick Stobbs recently sat in a conference room here playing songs from his smartphone, attempting to show how his start-up, Jukedeck, is at the cutting edge of music. The tune sounded like the soundtrack to a 1980s video game. This is where we were two years ago, he said, looking slightly embarrassed.

title: Review: Bruckner, Then a Cultural Call to Arms, at Carnegie Hall
description: While the inauguration of a new president after a bitterly contentious election dominated the news all day Friday, the conductor and pianist Daniel Barenboim, in an eloquent speech at Carnegie Hall, defended the importance of culture and community at a time of division.

title: The Evenings, a Dutch Classic, Arrives in English. It Only Took 70 Years.
description: AMSTERDAM  Reviewers have compared it favorably to J .D. Salingers The Catcher in the Rye, Albert Camuss The Stranger and Karl Ove Knausgaards My Struggle. In The Irish Times, Eileen Battersby called it one of the finest studies of youthful malaise ever written, and in The Guardian, Tim Parks described it as not only a masterpiece but a cornerstone manqu of modern European literature.

title: Renewed Fighting and Drone Strikes in Yemen Kill About 75
description: SANA, Yemen  Renewed fighting in the Yemen conflict killed about 75 people on Saturday and Sunday, some of them in the first drone strikes launched during the new administration of President Trump, according to Yemeni news reports.

title: Now That Trump Is President, How Will TV Respond?
description: PASADENA, Calif.  Scripted television got bigger and richer during the Obama years. What will happen to it in the Trump era?

title: Two Museum Exhibits, Refracting a Divide
description: WASHINGTON  On the first full day in which Barack Obama officially became the former president, visitors to the National Museum of African American History and Culture paused at the end of a sprawling exhibition titled A Journey to Freedom.

title: 75 Arrested in European Crackdown on Art Trafficking
description: MADRID  The European police have arrested 75 people and recovered about 3,500 stolen archaeological artifacts and other artworks as part of the dismantling of an international network of art traffickers.

title: What It Takes to Tango
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  We see a lot of themes in our puzzles where one word in each theme entry suggests something that holds the theme together. Today we have a theme by Bruce Haight that breaks down the name of an old story for us.

title: Foreign Payments to Trump Firms Violate Constitution, Suit Will Claim
description: WASHINGTON  A team of prominent constitutional scholars, Supreme Court litigators and former White House ethics lawyers intends to file a lawsuit Monday morning alleging that President Trump is violating the Constitution by allowing his hotels and other business operations to accept payments from foreign governments.

title: Malaria and the Silent Spring
description: The author Rachel Carsons strike against the pesticide DDT turned her into both an environmental hero and a foil for those who believe regulation has gone too far. That fight is more relevant than ever.

title: Traveling Is Stressful, but Do It With Us, Companies Say
description: A contentious political climate has some Americans eager to escape, and a growing number of travel companies are tapping into that angst in a curiously effective way: by reminding them that travel can be cramped, hectic or disappointing.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Jan. 23
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Rachel Carson, DDT and the Fight Against Malaria
description: The advent of the Trump administration brings a designated head of the Environmental Protection Agency whose commitment to the E and P of E.P.A. is widely suspect.

title: News Media, Target of Trumps Declaration of War, Expresses Alarm
description: For wary Washington journalists, it seemed only a matter of time before Donald J. Trumps presidency would lead to a high-tension standoff between his administration and the news media.

title: One President With Two Very Different Twitter Voices
description: WASHINGTON  America inaugurated two very different presidents on Friday.

title: Protests in Bangladesh Shake a Global Workshop for Apparel
description: At first, the police knocked. Then they tried to kick the door down.

title: Trumps Health Plan Would Convert Medicaid to Block Grants, Aide Says
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps plan to replace the Affordable Care Act will propose giving each state a fixed amount of federal money in the form of a block grant to provide health care to low-income people on Medicaid, a top adviser to Mr. Trump said in an interview broadcast on Sunday.

title: It Was Always the Words
description: When I was a child, my father gave me a necklace called a lavaliere. I loved the sound of the word more than the object. When my mother sewed on her old foot-pedal Singer, I heard the words bobbin, remnant, selvage. Grandma gave me the Italian words tarantella, mozzarella, Campagna.

title: Alternative Facts and the Costs of Trump-Branded Reality
description: When Donald J. Trump swore the presidential oath on Friday, he assumed responsibility not only for the levers of government but also for one of the United States most valuable assets, battered though it may be: its credibility.

title: Retrial for Law Executives, U.S. Economic Growth Findings and Auto Industry and Trump
description: Heres a look at whats coming up this week:

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I thought I was being smart in going to the doctor and getting checked out. Then I tried to go get insurance and everyone denied me.

title: To Secular Bangladeshis, Textbook Changes Are a Harbinger
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  Bangladeshs Education Ministry was preparing to print the 2017 editions of its standard Bengali textbooks when a group of conservative Islamic religious scholars demanded the removal of 17 poems and stories they deemed atheistic.

title: The Numbers Game of Donald Trump
description: For 18 months, Donald J. Trump the candidate described polling leads he did not always maintain and vote tallies he did not always receive  and, especially, crowd sizes he did not always have.

title: Trump Presidency Is Already Altering Israeli-Palestinian Politics
description: JERUSALEM  Just two days old, the presidency of Donald J. Trump is already reshaping the politics between Israelis and Palestinians, on issues from the location of the American Embassy to possible annexation of a major settlement bloc to whether Palestinians are on the edge of a renewed revolt.

title: Peter Abrahams, a South African Who Wrote of Apartheid and Identity, Dies at 97
description: Peter Abrahams, a South African writer whose journalism and novels explored, with sensitivity and passion, the injustices of apartheid and the complexities of racial politics, died on Wednesday at his home in Kingston, Jamaica. He was 97.

title: Falcons Thrash Packers to Reach Second Super Bowl
description: ATLANTA  After nine N.F.L. seasons and 149 regular-season and postseason games, Matt Ryan knew well what was being said of him. Yes, Ryan, 31, already ranked statistically among the elite quarterbacks in N.F.L. history. But there were other numbers, such as his losing record as a starter in the playoffs and a winless mark in conference championship games.

title: Trump Wont Release His Tax Returns, a Top Aide Says
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has no intention of releasing his tax returns, his senior counselor said on Sunday, ruling out a step he had said he would take once an Internal Revenue Service audit was completed.

title: Trump Speaks With Netanyahu, Seeking to Thaw U.S. Relations
description: WASHINGTON  As the Trump administration moved toward relocating the United States Embassy to Jerusalem, President Trump on Sunday invited Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel to the White House early next month, working quickly to forge close ties with a crucial ally who was often at odds with his predecessor.

title: United Airlines Flights Are Delayed by Computer Problem
description: A computer problem forced United Airlines to ground all domestic flights for two and a half hours on Sunday night, an airline spokeswoman said.

title: Rocky First Weekend for Trump Troubles Even His Top Aides
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps first weekend in office unfolded much the way things often did during his campaign: with angry Twitter messages, a familiar obsession with slights and a series of meandering and at times untrue statements, all eventually giving way to attempts at damage control.

title: End of Biden Vice Presidency Dims Eight-Year Spotlight on Delaware
description: GREENVILLE, Del.  The state beverage of Delaware is milk, and as Angelina Squillace was stocking it in a grocery store here, she paused, in response to a question, to think about what else defined this state.

title: Danielle Macdonalds Star Turn in Patti Cake$ Is the Buzz of Sundance
description: PARK CITY, Utah  Not since Jennifer Lawrence have I seen a star like this.

title: Review: An Orange Julius Bond Is Complicated
description: Every year on Veterans Day, a man named Julius and his younger daughter, Nut, would gather around the television to watch war movies together: Platoon, Full Metal Jacket, Apocalypse Now.

title: Review: The Oregon Trail Traverses Tough Terrain in Two Different Eras
description: Being a teenage girl is the worst! The unrequited crushes, the cascading hormones, the constant threat of cholera. In Bekah Brunstetters The Oregon Trail, produced by Fault Line Theater, Jane (Liba Vaynberg), a 13-year-old in the 1990s, is playing the titular game  a wildly popular piece of edutainment software that taught a generation of kids about pioneer life  in her schools computer lab.

title: Homeland Season 6, Episode 2: Carrie Is Back to Her Old Self, Bending Rules
description: If there ever was a time for an I love you on Homeland, it was tonight.

title: Galaxy Note 7 Fires Caused by Battery and Design Flaws, Samsung Says
description: HONG KONG  Samsung, the South Korean conglomerate, blamed battery manufacturing problems and design flaws for the embarrassing and costly failure of its Galaxy Note 7 smartphone and apologized to its customers and suppliers.

title: Ronald Webster, Leader Who Plotted Anguilla Revolution, Dies at 90
description: In 1967, when Britain was shedding the vestiges of its empire, Ronald Webster emerged as the George Washington of the tiny Caribbean island of Anguilla  in reverse. He plotted a revolution to embrace the mother country rather than to break with it.

title: Tom Brady and Patriots Overwhelm Steelers and Advance to Super Bowl LI
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  The play that secured the New England Patriots passage into the Super Bowl, that repudiated hints of their vulnerability and punctuated a season-long transformation, occurred in the second quarter Sunday.

title: The Affair Season 3, Episode 9: The Truth About Gunther
description: It was the best of The Affair, it was the worst of The Affair. Though the worst outnumbered the best by two or three to one.

title: Heng on the South Korean Scandal
description: If Choi Soon-sil, President Park Geun-hyes confidant, is arrested, it will be a milestone in South Koreas efforts to fight corruption.

title: WNBA Players in Turkey Worry About Rise in Terror
description: Kiah Stokes celebrated New Years Eve at a nightclub in Istanbul, where she plays basketball for Besiktas of the Turkish league. But a night of revelry turned alarming when club employees told patrons they had to shut down early for security reasons.

title: Wider Racial Gap Found in Cervical Cancer Deaths

The article, which ran on Snapchats news service, Discover, appeared with a picture of a bikini-clad blond woman taking a selfie, even though the piece was about a fully clothed man.

title: A D.J. Who Brought Two Decades to Life

title: Our New Age of Contempt
description: Anyone who hoped that 2017 might bring a change in the tone of our political discourse has by now been thoroughly disappointed. The remarkable degree of contempt that characterized the 2016 election has shown no sign of abating in President Donald J. Trumps first days in office.

title: We Are Dissidents; We Are Legion
description: On Friday, Donald J. Trump, the embodiment, instrument and provocateur of American animus, was installed  and I use that word with purpose and displeasure  as Americas 45th president. He delivered a particularly inauspicious speech to a seemingly sparse crowd, presenting a vision for America that would best be described as aggressive atavism, a retrograde positioning of policy that threatens to drag the country back to a time of division and fear and hostility, when some stand in the light by casting others into darkness.

title: Things Can Only Get Worse
description: If America had a parliamentary system, Donald Trump  who spent his first full day in office having a temper tantrum, railing against accurate reports of small crowds at his inauguration  would already be facing a vote of no confidence. But we dont; somehow were going to have to survive four years of this.

title: Why BuzzFeed News Published the Dossier
description: Since BuzzFeed News published a 35-page dossier of unverified allegations about ties between President Donald J. Trump and Russia, Ive heard a chorus of criticism from journalists who say we abdicated our role as gatekeeper, and a chorus of thanks from readers who want to be trusted to judge dubious documents.

title: Discovering Feminist Students in the Middle East
description: ABU DHABI, United Arab Emirates  My grandmother told me that the man is the head and the woman is the neck, said an East European student in my class. It makes me so mad. I dont want to be the neck.

title: Peter Hujars Gay Lower East Side: Out of the Shadows
description: Every enclave seems to produce one successful photographer. On the Lower East Sides gay arts scene of the 1970s, Robert Mapplethorpe broke out to achieve fame and notoriety. But, there was also Peter Hujar, Mapplethorpes prolific contemporary. He, like Mapplethorpe, depicted aspects of gay life, was an insider among a circle of famous artists and writers, and even preferred the square format. Yet his photographs, overshadowed by Mapplethorpes, tell different stories. Now, 30 years after he died from complications of AIDS, Mr. Hujar is finally getting his due: a traveling retrospective, organized by the Morgan Library & Museum.

title: When Making a Fraud Claim, Choose Your Filing Date Wisely
description: The adage that timing in life is everything can be especially important when there is a claim of fraud, because the window to bring a case can close quickly and decisively under the applicable statute of limitations. This is the type of technical requirement that lawyers love to use to block a lawsuit. Failing to act on time means any chance at recovery is lost, letting a potential wrongdoer get off scot-free.

description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court rejected on Monday an appeal from Texas officials seeking to restore the states strict voter ID law.

title: A Second Act for Pujol, Mexicos World-Class Restaurant
description: MEXICO CITY  Seventeen years after putting its city and its chef on the world culinary map with its playfully elevated street food, Pujol, Mexicos most celebrated restaurant, will serve the final meal in its building on Calle Francisco Petrarca sometime in the coming weeks.

title: Why a Trident Missile Test Is Rocking British Politics
description: LONDON  Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain found herself in political hot water on Monday over reports that an unarmed Trident missile went astray during a test at sea in June, and that the government kept the incident a secret. Ms. May was initially unwilling to acknowledge that she was aware of the test when she urged Parliament in July to invest in new Trident-armed submarines. Here is a look at the weapon and concerns about a possible cover-up.

title: Trump Org Chart and Letter From House Dems
description: This chart shows the ownership arrangement behind the company the Trump family set up to control the Trump International Hotel in Washington. A letter that House Democrats sent on Monday also details how revenues at the hotel in its first two months were lower than had been projected.

title: Ancient Bits of Rock Help Solve an Asteroid Mystery
description: An asteroid is a smaller-than-a-planet rock orbiting in the inner solar system. A meteor is the streak of light of a space rock plunging into the atmosphere, and a meteorite is the remnant of space rock that survives the fiery descent and comes to rest on the ground.

title: Vivienne Westwood: Punk? Yes. Political? Maybe.
description: I was staring at the golden bovine hooves that foot the clothing racks in the new Vivienne Westwood store. Theyre deadly, people are tripping, a saleswoman told me in the same helpful tone as, Ill put that in a dressing room. Out of earshot of the warning, my partner, Carrie, walked over to me, started to flip through the rack and promptly tripped.

title: Produce Butchers, Detroit Pizza and More at New Whole Foods
description: For its 11th store in New York City, a two-story expanse opening near Bryant Park on Saturday, Whole Foods has turned to local chefs and makers. Seed & Mill, a halvah company, will have a cart selling tahini ground on the spot. Frankies Spuntino, a branch of Frankies 457 and 570 Spuntino, will dish out salads, sandwiches and pastas. Maria Loi of Loi Estiatorio will sell her new line of dips and spreads. Harbor Bar will serve raw and other seafood items, including some by Daniel Boulud. Simit & Smith will offer artisanal Turkish breads. Other features include Detroit-style square pizza, a toast counter and omakase from Genji Sushis restaurant Kano. There will also be a produce butcher on hand, to clean, trim and custom-cut your fruit and vegetables to order: Whole Foods Market Bryant Park, 1095 Avenue of the Americas (41st Street), wholefoodsmarket.com.

title: Poster Perfect: The Art of James McMullan
description: No other living artist is more closely identified with an American theater company than James McMullan. For 30 years, his painterly posters for Lincoln Center Theater have been turned into collectibles that are more than advertising: Theyre synonymous with the shows themselves. Its hard to think of Carousel without recalling his artwork for the 1994 revival that depicts a brooding Billy Bigelow, vividly illuminated from below, atop wooden horses that rear beneath an angry sky.

title: Judge Blocks Aetnas $37 Billion Deal for Humana
description: A federal judge ruled on Monday that a $37 billion merger between the health insurance giants Aetna and Humana should not be allowed to go through on antitrust grounds, siding with the Justice Department, which had been seeking to block the deal.

title: Trump Revives Ban on Foreign Aid to Groups That Give Abortion Counseling

title: Senators Propose Giving States Option to Keep Affordable Care Act
description: WASHINGTON  Several Republican senators on Monday proposed a partial replacement for the Affordable Care Act that would allow states to continue operating under the law if they choose, a proposal meant to appeal to critics and supporters of former President Barack Obamas signature health law.

title: An Elegant Dispenser for Soy Sauce
description: On my table, products from commercial packages like milk, juices and many condiments are decanted into pitchers, small bowls or other containers. This tidy soy sauce glass cruet is designed with an effective no-drip pouring spout built into the stopper: Soy Sauce Cruet, $40 ($36 for members), momastore.org.

title: Protests Over Bull Riding Turn Violent in India
description: NEW DELHI  In the traditional bull-wrestling sport of jallikattu, men compete for prizes based on their ability to ride or hold on to a bull that is released into a crowd. But after years of complaints about cruelty to the animals, the Supreme Court issued a ban on the practice, leading to protests in the southern state of Tamil Nadu over the past week.

title: Crispy Pork Rinds, Ready for the Super Bowl Spread
description: Feather-light fried pork rinds from 4505 Meats in San Francisco are available nationally for the first time. They are ready for snacking or dipping and come in three flavors: classic with a light dusting of chile, jalapeo with white Cheddar, and smoky barbecue: 4505 Chicharrones, $18 for four one-ounce bags, amazon.com.

title: New Jersey Bakery Adds New York to the Menu
description: Ptisserie Florentine has crossed the Hudson River, from Englewood, N.J., to the East Village. The Manhattan branch is smaller than the original, but sells some excellent creations, including whole-grain croissants, cookies, tartlets and a krantz cake, a twisted coffee cake threaded with chocolate that is essentially a babka. The owners, Tomer and Itay Zilkha, took on a new partner, Guy Jacobovitz, to run the shop. Sandwiches and savory quiches are also sold, and cakes and tarts are available to order: Ptisserie Florentine, 280 East 10th Street, 212-995-0300, patisserieflorentine.com.

title: Go Ahead and Eat This Cookie Dough
description: Kristen Tomlans secret treat has long been raw cookie dough. I loved sneaking it, eating it with a spoon, she said. About two years ago, she began selling a version online thats vegetarian, bakeable and safe to eat raw. Now, she is expanding with a Greenwich Village store, adding dough flavors, freezing it to make ice cream sandwiches and crumbling it on sundaes and in milkshakes. Blue Marble Ice Cream is using the dough in its cookie dough ice cream, which is also sold in the shop. Brownie dough, baked cookies and ice cream pies are available: Do, 550 La Guardia Place (West Third Street), 646-892-3600, cookiedonyc.com.
